analyzed: sa bon du ster ba'o //
translated: In the future, it is the seed of the uṣṇīṣa on the Buddha’s head or the seed that grants the great qualities that arise like a wish-fulfilling jewel.

original: rdo rje'i dbang bskur ba ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i ngo bos so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bcu gnyis kyi 'khor lo rnam par dag pa'i tshul du rdo rje sor bcu gnyis pa lte ba zlum po chos kyi
analyzed: rdo rje'i dbang bskur ba ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i ngo bos so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bcu gnyis kyi 'khor lo rnam par dag pa'i tshul du rdo rje sor bcu gnyis pa lte ba zlum po chos kyi
translated: The vajra empowerment is conferred by means of the essence of Amitābha, the nature of the wisdom of discernment, in the manner of the pure twelve links of dependent origination.🔽

original: dbyings mtha' thams cad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: dbyings mtha' thams cad dang bral ba'o //
translated: The vajra empowerment is conferred by means of the essence of Amitābha, the nature of the wisdom of discernment, in the manner of the purity of the wheel of the twelve links of dependent origination. The twelve-finger-span vajra has a round hub, the dharmadhātu free from all extremes.

original: lte ba'i yi ge h'um ni chos nyid mtshon par byed pa ste /🔽ha ni he tu yog zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lte ba'i yi ge h'um ni chos nyid mtshon par byed pa ste / ha ni he tu yog zhes bya ste /
translated: The syllable hūṃ in the hub symbolizes dharmatā.

original: rgyu dang bral pa ste ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang bral pa ste ma skyes pa'o //
translated: Ha is hetu yog, free from a cause, unborn.

original: aa'u ni rtog pa dang bral ba'o //🔽aa ni @171a * //
analyzed: aa'u ni rtog pa dang bral ba'o // aa ni @171a * //
translated: Ā is free from conceptuality.

original: aa pra ti ha ta zhes bya ba ste mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: aa pra ti ha ta zhes bya ba ste mi gnas pa'o //
translated: A is apratihata, unhindered.

original: padma'i kha nas skyes pa'i rdo rje'i rtse mo lnga ni padma las skye ba bzhin du 'khor ba'i chos la yang 'dod pa skye bas 'khor ba las skye ba'i phung po lnga rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: padma'i kha nas skyes pa'i rdo rje'i rtse mo lnga ni padma las skye ba bzhin du 'khor ba'i chos la yang 'dod pa skye bas 'khor ba las skye ba'i phung po lnga rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The five tips of the vajra born from the lotus are the purity of the five aggregates born from saṃsāra, since desire arises for the phenomena of saṃsāra, just as [desire arises] for that born from a lotus.

original: phyogs kyi rtse mo bzhi dbus kyi rtse mo la phyogs pa ni chos thams cad sems kyi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: phyogs kyi rtse mo bzhi dbus kyi rtse mo la phyogs pa ni chos thams cad sems kyi ngo bo ste /
translated: The four directional tips pointing to the central tip indicate that all phenomena are the essence of mind.

original: sems las logs shig na phyi'i don med do //
analyzed: sems las logs shig na phyi'i don med do //
translated: There are no external objects apart from the mind.

original: sems nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pas stong pa'o //
analyzed: sems nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pas stong pa'o //
translated: The mind itself is empty of object and subject.

original: rang rig pa nyid de de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbugs dbyung ba'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid de de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbugs dbyung ba'o //
translated: Self-awareness itself is the solace of the tathāgatas.

original: me tog gsum gyis ra rnams la mtshon pa ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum ste /
analyzed: me tog gsum gyis ra rnams la mtshon pa ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum ste /
translated: The three flowers that indicate the ra syllables are the three gates of liberation.

original: sems nyid stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa ston pa nyid du byed pa ste /
analyzed: sems nyid stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa ston pa nyid du byed pa ste /
translated: They are the mind itself, which is emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: rdo rje 'chang gi dbugs dbyung ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang gi dbugs dbyung ba'o //
translated: This is the solace of Vajradhara.

original: de lta bu'i rdo rje slob ma'i lag tu gtang pa ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gnyis su med pa'i ye shes mtshon par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rdo rje slob ma'i lag tu gtang pa ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gnyis su med pa'i ye shes mtshon par byed pa ste /
translated: The entrusting of such a vajra disciple with the vajra is the indication of the nondual wisdom that is the nature of all phenomena.

original: dbyer mi phyed pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo ster ba dang / ngas khyod la gnyis su med pa'i ye shes sbyin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbyer mi phyed pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo ster ba dang / ngas khyod la gnyis su med pa'i ye shes sbyin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The nature of the indivisible intuition is given, and the meaning of the statement “I give you the intuition of nonduality” is this.

original: dril bu'i dbang bskur ba ni don yod grub ba'i ngo bo bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: dril bu'i dbang bskur ba ni don yod grub ba'i ngo bo bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: The bell empowerment is Amoghasiddhi, the nature of the intuition of successful action.

original: dgongs pa snga ma'i tshul gyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar bcu gnyis kyi 'khor lo rnam par dag pa'i tshul gyis sor bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa snga ma'i tshul gyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar bcu gnyis kyi 'khor lo rnam par dag pa'i tshul gyis sor bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: The bell is twelve fingerbreadths in length, in the manner of the previous intentions, in the manner of the purity of the twelve-fold dependent origination.

original: kha thur du bltas pa ni shes rab kyi padma mchon par byed pa'o //
analyzed: kha thur du bltas pa ni shes rab kyi padma mchon par byed pa'o //
translated: The face is turned downward, in order to open the lotus of wisdom.

original: dbyer mi byed pa'i gnas chos kyi 'byung gnas rtogs pa'i phyir dril bu'i steng dang 'og gi cha la rdo rje'i phreng b zung gis mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: dbyer mi byed pa'i gnas chos kyi 'byung gnas rtogs pa'i phyir dril bu'i steng dang 'og gi cha la rdo rje'i phreng b zung gis mdzes pa'o //
translated: The upper and lower parts of the bell are beautified by a pair of vajra garlands, in order to realize the indivisible place, the source of phenomena.

original: sgra dgrol ba ni thabs dang shes rab kyi rdo rje dang padma mnyam par sbyor ba sta /
analyzed: sgra dgrol ba ni thabs dang shes rab kyi rdo rje dang padma mnyam par sbyor ba sta /
translated: The sound is released, in order to unite the vajra and lotus of method and wisdom.

original: chos thams cad rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas na rang gi ngo bo ma skyes ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas na rang gi ngo bo ma skyes ste /
translated: Since all phenomena are dependently arisen, they are not essentially produced.

original: sgra de yang btsal na gang nas kyang mi rnyed pa ste /
analyzed: sgra de yang btsal na gang nas kyang mi rnyed pa ste /
translated: Moreover, if one searches for that sound, it is not found anywhere.

original: yang dag par rang bzhin med la /
analyzed: yang dag par rang bzhin med la /
translated: It is ultimately without intrinsic nature.

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad rang bzhin med par rtogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad rang bzhin med par rtogs par byed pa'o //
translated: In the same way, one should understand that all phenomena are without intrinsic nature.

original: khams gsum thams cad kyi ngo bo dkyil 'khor du bstan pa'i phyir dra ba dang dra ba phyed pa ste /
analyzed: khams gsum thams cad kyi ngo bo dkyil 'khor du bstan pa'i phyir dra ba dang dra ba phyed pa ste /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the nature of the entire three realms is a maṇḍala, [the text says] “with nets and half-nets.”

original: de la dra ba dang dra ba phyed pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la dra ba dang dra ba phyed pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, “nets and half-nets”

original: har dang har aardha zhes bya ste /
analyzed: har dang har aardha zhes bya ste /
translated: means “jāla and jāla-ardha.”

original: 'phrog pa dang 'phrog par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'phrog pa dang 'phrog par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It means “to steal” and “to cause to steal.”

original: dra ba ni nyon mongs pa chen po bcom pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: dra ba ni nyon mongs pa chen po bcom pa'i rtags so //
translated: The net is a sign of conquering great afflictions.

original: dra ba phyed pa ni nyon mongs pa chung ngu bcom pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: dra ba phyed pa ni nyon mongs pa chung ngu bcom pa'i rtags so //
translated: The half-net is a sign of conquering lesser afflictions.

original: rten gzhan yas khang der brten pa lha'i @171b dkyil 'khor bstan pa dang / phung po dang khams la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs par bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang lha mo rnams kyi phyag mtshan bkod pa'o //
analyzed: rten gzhan yas khang der brten pa lha'i @171b dkyil 'khor bstan pa dang / phung po dang khams la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs par bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang lha mo rnams kyi phyag mtshan bkod pa'o //
translated: In order to teach that the aggregates, elements, and so on are the tathāgatas, the implements of the five tathāgatas and goddesses are arrayed.

original: stong pa dang snying rje dbyer mi phyed pa'i rang bzhin nam rgyu bstan pa'i phyir de steng du shes rab kyi gdong bstan pa'o //🔽padmo las skyes pa'i rtse mo lnga ni srid pa las skyes pa'i phung po'am /
analyzed: stong pa dang snying rje dbyer mi phyed pa'i rang bzhin nam rgyu bstan pa'i phyir de steng du shes rab kyi gdong bstan pa'o // padmo las skyes pa'i rtse mo lnga ni srid pa las skyes pa'i phung po'am /
translated: In order to teach the cause, which is the nature of inseparable emptiness and compassion, the face of wisdom is displayed above that.

original: sa la sogs pa 'byung ba lnga rnam par dag pa'i ye shes lnga'i ngo bo de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa 'byung ba lnga rnam par dag pa'i ye shes lnga'i ngo bo de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'o //
translated: The five tips that arise from the lotus are the five tathāgatas, the nature of the five pristine consciousnesses that purify the five aggregates that arise from existence or the five elements such as earth.

original: phyogs kyi rtse mo rnams dbus kyi rtse mo la phyogs pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i chos thams cad sems las phyi rol du med de /
analyzed: phyogs kyi rtse mo rnams dbus kyi rtse mo la phyogs pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i chos thams cad sems las phyi rol du med de /
translated: The tips of the directions are directed toward the central tip because all phenomena of the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so on are not outside of the mind.

original: sems kyi ngo bo gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rtog pas stong pa rang rig pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: sems kyi ngo bo gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rtog pas stong pa rang rig pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The essence of mind is the wisdom of self-awareness, empty of the concepts of subject and object.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbugs dbyung ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbugs dbyung ba'o //
translated: This is the solace of the Tathagata.

original: ra rnams la me tog gsum mtshan pa ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum ste /
analyzed: ra rnams la me tog gsum mtshan pa ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum ste /
translated: The three flower signs on the bells are the three gates of liberation.

original: sems nyid stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pas sems nyid rang bzhin med pa ste /
analyzed: sems nyid stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pas sems nyid rang bzhin med pa ste /
translated: The nature of mind is emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, and the nature of mind is essenceless.

original: rdo rje 'chang gi dbugs dbyung ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang gi dbugs dbyung ba'o //
translated: This is the solace of Vajradhara.

original: de lta bu'i dril bu slob ma'i lag tu gtad pa ni rjod par byed ba'i sgra dang chos nyid rtogs par byed pa'i rgyu ster ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i dril bu slob ma'i lag tu gtad pa ni rjod par byed ba'i sgra dang chos nyid rtogs par byed pa'i rgyu ster ba'o //
translated: The entrusting of the bell to the disciple in this way is the bestowal of the cause of realizing the sound of expression and reality.

original: mig gi dbang bskur ba ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi ngo bo chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: mig gi dbang bskur ba ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi ngo bo chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: The empowerment of the eyes is the nature of the wisdom of the dharmadhatu, the essence of Vairochana.

original: chos thams cad sgrom btags pa dang / ming med mtshon par byed pa'i phyir sngar kyi ming dor ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad sgrom btags pa dang / ming med mtshon par byed pa'i phyir sngar kyi ming dor ba'o //
translated: Since all phenomena are sealed and indicated without names, the previous names are discarded.

original: phyis kyi ming 'dogs pa ni me tog gar lhung ba'i rang gi rigs kyi lha las ming drangs nas 'dogs pa ste /
analyzed: phyis kyi ming 'dogs pa ni me tog gar lhung ba'i rang gi rigs kyi lha las ming drangs nas 'dogs pa ste /
translated: The later name is derived from the deity of one's own family, into which the flower falls.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi go 'phang la 'os pa'am skal ba dang ldan no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi go 'phang la 'os pa'am skal ba dang ldan no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, One is worthy or has the fortune of the state of unexcelled enlightenment.

original: de ltar dbang lnga po de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ngo bo yin bas rigs lnga'i dbang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar dbang lnga po de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ngo bo yin bas rigs lnga'i dbang zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, since those five empowerments are the nature of the five tathagatas, they are called the empowerments of the five families.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyis ma rig pa bkag nas rig pa'i ngo bor byas pas na rig pa'i dbang lnga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyis ma rig pa bkag nas rig pa'i ngo bor byas pas na rig pa'i dbang lnga zhes bya'o //
translated: Since ignorance is stopped by the nature of the five tathagatas and the five pristine consciousnesses and is made into the nature of knowledge, they are called the five empowerments of knowledge.

original: rjes su gnang ba dang / de nas gzhan yang drug pa ni rdo rje sems dpa'i dbang zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rjes su gnang ba dang / de nas gzhan yang drug pa ni rdo rje sems dpa'i dbang zhes bya ste /
translated: Next, the sixth is called the empowerment of Vajrasattva.

original: rdo rje rigs kyi dam tshig rdo rje ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes zung du 'jug pa brjod par bya ba yin pas khyod kyis nam yang mi 'bral bar bya zhing rtogs par bya ba'i dam tshig go //
analyzed: rdo rje rigs kyi dam tshig rdo rje ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes zung du 'jug pa brjod par bya ba yin pas khyod kyis nam yang mi 'bral bar bya zhing rtogs par bya ba'i dam tshig go //
translated: The pledge of the vajra family is the indivisible pristine awareness of bliss and emptiness, which is to be realized and never separated from.🔽

original: dril bu'i dbang rigs kyi dam tshig la dril @172a * //🔽bu ni chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong gi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: dril bu'i dbang rigs kyi dam tshig la dril @172a * // bu ni chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong gi rang bzhin te /
translated: The pledge of the vajra family is the indivisible pristine awareness of union, which is to be realized and never separated from.

original: rjod bar byed pa yin pas khyod kyis sems can rnams la bsgrag par bya'o zhes rtogs par bya ba ni dam tshig go //
analyzed: rjod bar byed pa yin pas khyod kyis sems can rnams la bsgrag par bya'o zhes rtogs par bya ba ni dam tshig go //
translated: The pledge of the bell family is to proclaim the Dharma to all sentient beings.

original: phyag rgya rigs kyi dam tshig zhi rang nyid yi dam lha'i ngo bor rtogs par bya ba ni dam tshig go //
analyzed: phyag rgya rigs kyi dam tshig zhi rang nyid yi dam lha'i ngo bor rtogs par bya ba ni dam tshig go //
translated: The pledge of the seal family is to realize that one’s own nature is that of the deity.

original: de dag ni rigs gsum gyi dam tshig go //🔽snod du bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid dang / dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par dag pa dang / lha'i de kho na nyid dang / lha'i rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: de dag ni rigs gsum gyi dam tshig go //🔽snod du bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid dang / dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par dag pa dang / lha'i de kho na nyid dang / lha'i rnam par dag pa /
translated: These are the pledges of the three families.🔽The pledges of the five awarenesses are to recognize the five aggregates as the five male and female tathāgatas.

original: slob dpon gyi las dang / dkyil 'khor bsgrub pa'i las dang / bza' ba la sogs pa'i dam tshig go //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi las dang / dkyil 'khor bsgrub pa'i las dang / bza' ba la sogs pa'i dam tshig go //
translated: The master's duties, the duties of the mandala practice, and the commitments of eating, etc.

original: rjes su gnang ba ni /
analyzed: rjes su gnang ba ni /
translated: The permission is:

original: sems can kun la phan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sems can kun la phan pa'i phyir //
translated: For the sake of the welfare of all sentient beings,

original: sems can kun la thams cad du //
analyzed: sems can kun la thams cad du //
translated: in all ways to all sentient beings,

original: ji ltar 'dul ba sna tshogs la //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dul ba sna tshogs la //
translated: in accordance with the various disciplines,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar gyis //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar gyis //
translated: turn the wheel of the doctrine.

original: khyod kyis sems can rnams la chos bshad pa dang / dbang bskur bar gyis shig pa'i gnang ba ste /🔽de dag bya ba'i skal ba dang ldan par rtogs par bya ba'o ;
analyzed: khyod kyis sems can rnams la chos bshad pa dang / dbang bskur bar gyis shig pa'i gnang ba ste / de dag bya ba'i skal ba dang ldan par rtogs par bya ba'o ;
translated: This is the permission to teach the doctrine and confer initiation to sentient beings.

original: / rdo rje'i brtul zhugs kyi dbang ni phyi rol gyi dka' thub kyi brtul zhugs spangs te gnyis su med pa 'di ni khyod kyi brtul zhugs yin pas zung shig pa'i don du rdo rje ster ba'o //
analyzed: / rdo rje'i brtul zhugs kyi dbang ni phyi rol gyi dka' thub kyi brtul zhugs spangs te gnyis su med pa 'di ni khyod kyi brtul zhugs yin pas zung shig pa'i don du rdo rje ster ba'o //
translated: The initiation of the vajra conduct is the bestowal of the vajra for the purpose of taking up this nondual conduct, having abandoned the external conduct of asceticism.🔽The prophecy is:

original: lung bstan pa ni khyod nyid rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: lung bstan pa ni khyod nyid rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
translated: You are Vajrasattva yourself.

original: sangs rgyas kun dang mtshungs pa'o zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun dang mtshungs pa'o zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that it is equal to all the Buddhas.

original: dbugs dbyung ba ni 'di nas bzung nas slar ngan song du mi ltung ngo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbugs dbyung ba ni 'di nas bzung nas slar ngan song du mi ltung ngo zhes bya'o //
translated: The exhalation is the statement, From now on, one will not fall again into the lower realms.

original: drug po 'di dag ni rdo rje sems dpa'i ngo bo yin pas na rdo rje sems dpa'i dbang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: drug po 'di dag ni rdo rje sems dpa'i ngo bo yin pas na rdo rje sems dpa'i dbang zhes bya'o //
translated: These six are called the Vajrasattva empowerment because they are the essence of Vajrasattva.

original: bum pa'i bya ba thams cad la 'jug pa yin pas na bum pa'i dbang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bum pa'i bya ba thams cad la 'jug pa yin pas na bum pa'i dbang zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the vase empowerment because it is the entrance to all the activities of the vase.

original: slar ngan song du mi skye bas na phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: slar ngan song du mi skye bas na phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the irreversible empowerment because one will not be reborn again in the lower realms.

original: chos bshad pa'i skal ba dang ldan pas na slob dpon gyi dbang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos bshad pa'i skal ba dang ldan pas na slob dpon gyi dbang zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the master empowerment because one is fortunate to explain the Dharma.

original: ye shes lnga'am rigs lnga'i ngo bor lus dag par byed pas na lus rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes lnga'am rigs lnga'i ngo bor lus dag par byed pas na lus rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the purification of the body because it purifies the body in the nature of the five pristine awarenesses or the five families.

original: de dag ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rdo rje slob dpon gyi dbang mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rdo rje slob dpon gyi dbang mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: Those are the brief explanations of the master empowerment of the stage of generation.

original: da ni gzhan yang lha'i sgo nas rtogs par bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa'i kun brtags rnams gzhan dbang lha'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: da ni gzhan yang lha'i sgo nas rtogs par bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa'i kun brtags rnams gzhan dbang lha'i ngo bo ste /
translated: Now, moreover, in terms of the deities, the imagined, such as the aggregates, are the nature of the deities of the dependent.

original: de yang 'di skad du /
analyzed: de yang 'di skad du /
translated: Moreover, this is stated:

original: mdor na phung po lnga rnams ni //
analyzed: mdor na phung po lnga rnams ni //
translated: In brief, the five aggregates

original: sangs rgyas sngar ni rab tu grags //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sngar ni rab tu grags //
translated: are renowned as the five buddhas.

original: khams dang skye mtshad thams cad ni //
analyzed: khams dang skye mtshad thams cad ni //
translated: All the constituents and sources🔽are the supreme maṇḍala of bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor mchog / ces gsungs pas na phung po @172b lnga ni sangs rgyas lnga'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor mchog / ces gsungs pas na phung po @172b lnga ni sangs rgyas lnga'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: Therefore, the five aggregates are the nature of the five buddhas.

original: de la gzugs kyi phung po rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi phung po rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: Vairocana is the aggregate of form.

original: tshor ba'i phung po rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: Ratnasambhava is the aggregate of sensation.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po 'od dpag med do //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po 'od dpag med do //
translated: Amitābha is the aggregate of conception.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po don yod grub pa'o //
translated: Amoghasiddhi is the aggregate of formation.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po mi bskyod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po mi bskyod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Akṣobhya is the aggregate of consciousness.

original: phung po la sogs pa'i zhen pa spang ba'i phyir kun brtags phung po la gzhan dbang de bzhin gshegs pa lngas rgyas btab ste /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i zhen pa spang ba'i phyir kun brtags phung po la gzhan dbang de bzhin gshegs pa lngas rgyas btab ste /
translated: In order to abandon clinging to the aggregates and so on, the imagined is sealed by the five transcendent ones, the relative.

original: de yang / gang la gang gis rgyas btab pa /
analyzed: de yang / gang la gang gis rgyas btab pa /
translated: Whatever is sealed by whatever

original: de dang de yi ngo bor grags //
analyzed: de dang de yi ngo bor grags //
translated: is renowned as having that nature.

original: zhes bya bas phung po lnga de bzhin gshegs pa lngas rgyas btab pa'i dus na phung po lngar 'dzin pa'i zhen pa dang bral te de bzhin gshegs pa lngar rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya bas phung po lnga de bzhin gshegs pa lngas rgyas btab pa'i dus na phung po lngar 'dzin pa'i zhen pa dang bral te de bzhin gshegs pa lngar rtogs par byed do //
translated: When the five aggregates are sealed by the five transcendent ones, one is free from clinging to the five aggregates and realizes the five transcendent ones.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga yang tha dad ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga yang tha dad ma yin te /
translated: The five transcendent ones are not different.

original: rnam par snang mdzad ni sku /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad ni sku /
translated: Vairocana is the body.

original: 'od dpag tu med pa ni gsung /
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pa ni gsung /
translated: Amitābha is speech.

original: mi bskyod pa ni thugs /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa ni thugs /
translated: Akṣobhya is mind.

original: rin chen 'byung ldan ni yon tan /
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan ni yon tan /
translated: Ratnasambhava is qualities.

original: don yod grub pa ni phrin las so //
analyzed: don yod grub pa ni phrin las so //
translated: Amoghasiddhi is activity.

original: de ltar tha dad ma yin pa la tha dad gzhan dbang lha'i rnam par 'dzin pa'i zhen pa bzlog pa'i phyir dang / rnam par rig pa tsam du rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bzhi la mi bskyod pas btab ste /
analyzed: de ltar tha dad ma yin pa la tha dad gzhan dbang lha'i rnam par 'dzin pa'i zhen pa bzlog pa'i phyir dang / rnam par rig pa tsam du rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bzhi la mi bskyod pas btab ste /
translated: In order to reverse the attachment that apprehends the dependent nature as a different, divine form, and in order to realize that it is mere consciousness, Akshobhya seals the four.🔽As it is said:

original: de yang / gang dang gang la rgyas btab pa //
analyzed: de yang / gang dang gang la rgyas btab pa //
translated: Whatever is sealed

original: de dang de yi ngo bor 'gro //
analyzed: de dang de yi ngo bor 'gro //
translated: becomes the nature of that.

original: zhes gsungs pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa bzhi la mi bskyod pa rnam par shes pa'i phung po chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyis rgyas btab pas gzhan dbang lhar 'dzin pa'i zhen pa spangs nas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rtog pa spangs te gzungs ba🔽dang 'dzin pa'i rtog pas /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa bzhi la mi bskyod pa rnam par shes pa'i phung po chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyis rgyas btab pas gzhan dbang lhar 'dzin pa'i zhen pa spangs nas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rtog pa spangs te gzungs ba dang 'dzin pa'i rtog pas /
translated: Thus, since Akshobhya, the aggregate of consciousness, the gnosis of the dharmadhatu, seals Vairochana and the others, the attachment to apprehending the dependent nature as a deity is abandoned.

original: stong pa yongs su grub bas sems nyid rang rig par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa yongs su grub bas sems nyid rang rig par rtog pa ste /
translated: The concepts of subject and object are abandoned, and the mind itself is realized as reflexive awareness, the emptiness that is the perfected nature.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbugs dbyung ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbugs dbyung ba'o //
translated: This is the solace of the tathagatas.

original: de la da bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad dang / rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs par 'dzin cing rtog pas skyo zhing dub pa'i sdug bsngal bar gyur ba rnams mi bskyod pa sems kyi ngo bo dang rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la da bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad dang / rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs par 'dzin cing rtog pas skyo zhing dub pa'i sdug bsngal bar gyur ba rnams mi bskyod pa sems kyi ngo bo dang rig par bya ste /
translated: In this regard, those who are weary and exhausted by the suffering of grasping and conceiving the Tathāgatas as Vairocana, Ratnasaṃbhava, and so on, and the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so on, should know the essence of mind as Akṣhobhya.

original: rtog pa dang gzung 'dzin gyi zhen pa med par ngal sos pa'am dbugs dbyung bas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbugs dbyung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang gzung 'dzin gyi zhen pa med par ngal sos pa'am dbugs dbyung bas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbugs dbyung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since they are refreshed or relieved without the clinging of concepts and subject-object duality, it is called the relief of the Tathāgatas.

original: de yang gzud ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med kyang rig pa tsam du 'dzin pa'i zhen pa yod pas rnam par rtog pa'i zug rdul khyad par med de /
analyzed: de yang gzud ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med kyang rig pa tsam du 'dzin pa'i zhen pa yod pas rnam par rtog pa'i zug rdul khyad par med de /
translated: Moreover, even though there is no conceptualization or clinging to subject and object, there is still the clinging to the mere grasping of awareness, so the pain of conceptualization is not eliminated.

original: dper na lcags @173a * //
analyzed: dper na lcags @173a * //
translated: For example,

original: las byas pa'i sgrog dang / gser las byas pa'i sgrog la rgyu la khyad par yod kyang 'ching ba la khyad par med do //
analyzed: las byas pa'i sgrog dang / gser las byas pa'i sgrog la rgyu la khyad par yod kyang 'ching ba la khyad par med do //
translated: an iron chain and a golden chain have a difference in material, but there is no difference in their binding.

original: de ltar phyi rol du 'dzin pa dang / nang sems nyid rang rig par 'dzin pa la bzang dan yod kyang mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i zug rdu la khyad med pas de nyid kyi zhen pa spang ba'i phyir rnam par shes ba'i phung po'i rang bzhin mi bskyod pa la rdo rje sems dpa'i
analyzed: de ltar phyi rol du 'dzin pa dang / nang sems nyid rang rig par 'dzin pa la bzang dan yod kyang mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i zug rdu la khyad med pas de nyid kyi zhen pa spang ba'i phyir rnam par shes ba'i phung po'i rang bzhin mi bskyod pa la rdo rje sems dpa'i
translated: In order to abandon that very clinging, the nature of the aggregate of consciousness is sealed with Vajrasattva Akṣobhya.

original: rgyas btab ste /
analyzed: rgyas btab ste /
translated: It is said:

original: de yang / gang la gang gis rgyas btab pa //
analyzed: de yang / gang la gang gis rgyas btab pa //
translated: Whatever is sealed by whatever

original: de dang de yi ngo bor 'gro //
analyzed: de dang de yi ngo bor 'gro //
translated: will become the nature of just that.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: Thus,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' stong pa nyid kyis mi bskyod pa la rgyas btab pas sems nyid stong pa nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' stong pa nyid kyis mi bskyod pa la rgyas btab pas sems nyid stong pa nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: since Vajrasattva is sealed by emptiness, Akṣobhya is to be realized as the emptiness of mind itself.

original: de yang 'di skad du /
analyzed: de yang 'di skad du /
translated: Moreover, it is said:

original: snying po brtan phyir khong stong min //
analyzed: snying po brtan phyir khong stong min //
translated: Because the essence is stable, it is not hollow.

original: mi chod mi phyed mtshan nyid can //
analyzed: mi chod mi phyed mtshan nyid can //
translated: It has the characteristics of being indivisible and uncuttable.

original: mi tshig pa ngang mi nyams pas //
analyzed: mi tshig pa ngang mi nyams pas //
translated: Since it does not burn and does not deteriorate,

original: stong pa rdo rje zhes brjod do //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: stong pa rdo rje zhes brjod do //🔽zhes gsungs so //
translated: emptiness is called the vajra.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' stong pa nyid kyis ni rtog pa'i mtha' bsal la /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' stong pa nyid kyis ni rtog pa'i mtha' bsal la /
translated: Vajrasattva's emptiness eliminates the extreme of conceptualization.

original: mi bskyod pas ni chad pa'i mtha' bsal te zung du 'jug pa ni rdo rje 'chang gi dbugs dbyung pa ste /
analyzed: mi bskyod pas ni chad pa'i mtha' bsal te zung du 'jug pa ni rdo rje 'chang gi dbugs dbyung pa ste /
translated: Akshobhya eliminates the extreme of nihilism. Union is the solace of Vajradhara.

original: sems nyid rang rig pa'i zhen pa nyid rang bzhin med par byas te dbugs dbyung ba la rdo rje 'chang gi dbugs dbyung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems nyid rang rig pa'i zhen pa nyid rang bzhin med par byas te dbugs dbyung ba la rdo rje 'chang gi dbugs dbyung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The mind itself, which is self-knowing, is made to be without intrinsic nature. That solace is called the solace of Vajradhara.

original: phyi bskyed pa'i rim pa ste dbang po tha ma mdor bstan pa'o//
analyzed: phyi bskyed pa'i rim pa ste dbang po tha ma mdor bstan pa'o//
translated: That is the outer creation stage, the brief explanation for those of average faculties.

original: de nas gzhan yang zab mo bskyed pa'i rim pa la gsang ba'i dbang gis ngag rnam par dag bar byed pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang zab mo bskyed pa'i rim pa la gsang ba'i dbang gis ngag rnam par dag bar byed pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: Next, the profound creation stage will be explained. The secret empowerment purifies the voice.

original: de la gsang ba'i dbang ni dang po slob dpon gyi gsang ba'o //
analyzed: de la gsang ba'i dbang ni dang po slob dpon gyi gsang ba'o //
translated: In that, the secret empowerment is first the secret of the master.

original: yum dang gnyis bskyed pa'i rim pa lha'i nga rgyal du byas te /
analyzed: yum dang gnyis bskyed pa'i rim pa lha'i nga rgyal du byas te /
translated: The creation stage is made into the pride of the deity.

original: mkha' gsang byin gyis brlabs nas snyoms par zhugs te rang gi snying ga'i sa bon las 'od zer spros te /
analyzed: mkha' gsang byin gyis brlabs nas snyoms par zhugs te rang gi snying ga'i sa bon las 'od zer spros te /
translated: After the consecration of the space and the secret place, one enters into union and emanates light rays from the seed syllable in one's heart center.

original: phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad spyan drangs te de nyid du thim pa las 'od du zhu ba'i gnyis las byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems slob ma la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad spyan drangs te de nyid du thim pa las 'od du zhu ba'i gnyis las byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems slob ma la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: All the Tathagatas of the ten directions are invoked and dissolve into that very place. From the melting of light, the bodhicitta which arises from the two organs is given to the disciple.

original: de la gsang ba'i dbang la gnyis te /
analyzed: de la gsang ba'i dbang la gnyis te /
translated: The secret initiation has two parts:

original: rje btsun gyi gsang ba'i dpang dang / rje btsun ma'i gsang ba'i dbang ngo //
analyzed: rje btsun gyi gsang ba'i dpang dang / rje btsun ma'i gsang ba'i dbang ngo //
translated: the secret initiation of the Lord, and the secret initiation of the Lady.

original: rje btsun gyi gsang ba'i dbang ni byang chub kyi sems rdo rje las lces blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rje btsun gyi gsang ba'i dbang ni byang chub kyi sems rdo rje las lces blang bar bya'o //
translated: The secret initiation of the Lord is the bodhicitta which is taken with the tongue from the vajra.

original: rje btsun ma'i gsang ba'i dbang ni byang chub kyi sems padma nas lces blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rje btsun ma'i gsang ba'i dbang ni byang chub kyi sems padma nas lces blang bar bya'o //
translated: The secret initiation of the Lady is the bodhicitta which is taken with the tongue from the lotus.

original: de yang 'di skad du /
analyzed: de yang 'di skad du /
translated: Moreover, it is said:

original: lag tu blang @173b bar mi bya zhing //
analyzed: lag tu blang @173b bar mi bya zhing //
translated: Do not take it in the hand,

original: nya phyis dung chos dag tu min //
analyzed: nya phyis dung chos dag tu min //
translated: Nor in a mother-of-pearl shell or a conch.

original: mi 'chi lce yis blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'chi lce yis blang bar bya'o //
translated: Take it with the tongue, not with death.

original: zhes so // de bas na lce kho nas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes so // de bas na lce kho nas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, take it with the tongue alone.

original: ngag dag par byed pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'od du zhu ba'i byang chub kyi sems slob ma'i lce la gzhag pas zhi rgyas la sogs pa'i sngags nus pa dang ldan par grub par byed pa'am /
analyzed: ngag dag par byed pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'od du zhu ba'i byang chub kyi sems slob ma'i lce la gzhag pas zhi rgyas la sogs pa'i sngags nus pa dang ldan par grub par byed pa'am /
translated: The purification of speech is the establishment of the bodhicitta, which is the melting of all the Tathagatas into light, on the tongue of the disciple, which establishes the power of the mantras of pacification, increase, and so forth.

original: bza' bya dang bza' bya ma yin pa'i rtog pa dang / btung bya dang btung bya ma yin pa'i rtog pa bcom ste /
analyzed: bza' bya dang bza' bya ma yin pa'i rtog pa dang / btung bya dang btung bya ma yin pa'i rtog pa bcom ste /
translated: Or, it is the destruction of the concepts of what is to be eaten and what is not to be eaten, and the concepts of what is to be drunk and what is not to be drunk,

original: rang bzhin med par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin med par byed pa'o //
translated: and the making of them as having no intrinsic reality.

original: gsang ba ni thabs dang shes rab gnyis kyi gsang ba las byung bas na gsang ba'o //
analyzed: gsang ba ni thabs dang shes rab gnyis kyi gsang ba las byung bas na gsang ba'o //
translated: The secret is the secret, because it arises from the secret of the two, method and wisdom.

original: 'di'i don gnyis kyi snying po byin pas thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa 'byin no zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i don gnyis kyi snying po byin pas thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa 'byin no zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the giving of the essence of the two aims here gives rise to the nondual method and wisdom.

original: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbugs dbyung ba'i zab mo bskyed pa'i rim pa dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir rim pa bzhir 'dus te /
analyzed: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbugs dbyung ba'i zab mo bskyed pa'i rim pa dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir rim pa bzhir 'dus te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the profound exhalation of the Tathagatas, the generation stage, the perfection stage, and so forth, they are condensed into four stages.

original: las kyi phyag rgya dang / chos kyi phyag rgya dang / phyag rgya chen po dang dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya dang / chos kyi phyag rgya dang / phyag rgya chen po dang dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The seal of action, the seal of phenomena, the great seal, and the pledge seal.

original: de la dbang po rab kyi dbang du byas te las kyi phyag rgya la rim pa gnyis 'dus te /
analyzed: de la dbang po rab kyi dbang du byas te las kyi phyag rgya la rim pa gnyis 'dus te /
translated: With respect to that, from the perspective of the highest faculties, the seal of action is included in the two stages.

original: las kyi phyag rgya'i dus su tha mal pa'i 'du shes kyis gsungs pas lha'i ngo bor bsgom zhing mkha' gsang byin gyis brlabs pa ni phyi bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya'i dus su tha mal pa'i 'du shes kyis gsungs pas lha'i ngo bor bsgom zhing mkha' gsang byin gyis brlabs pa ni phyi bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: Since it is said that at the time of the seal of action, one meditates on the nature of the deity with ordinary ideation, the outer creation stage is the consecration of the secret spaces.

original: de nas bo la dang kakko la srub cing bsrub pa'i spyor bas de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbugs dbyung ba'ang rdo rje 'chang gi dbugs dbyung ba lnga rung ste /
analyzed: de nas bo la dang kakko la srub cing bsrub pa'i spyor bas de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbugs dbyung ba'ang rdo rje 'chang gi dbugs dbyung ba lnga rung ste /
translated: Then, through the practice of churning the bola and kakkola, the solace of the tathāgatas is the solace of Vajradhara.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes rig pa nyams su myong ba ni nang zab mo bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes rig pa nyams su myong ba ni nang zab mo bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The experience of the connate gnosis is the inner creation stage.

original: de ltar las kyi phyag rgya la rim pa gnyis dang ldan pas na rim pa bzhir 'dus te las kyi phyag rgya ni dpe'o //
analyzed: de ltar las kyi phyag rgya la rim pa gnyis dang ldan pas na rim pa bzhir 'dus te las kyi phyag rgya ni dpe'o //
translated: Since the seal of action is endowed with two stages, it is included in the four stages. The seal of action is the example.

original: chos kyi phyag rgya ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa ste lam mo //
analyzed: chos kyi phyag rgya ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa ste lam mo //
translated: The dharma seal is the stage of completion, which is the path.

original: phyag rgya chen po yongs su rdzogs pa'i rim pa ste 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po yongs su rdzogs pa'i rim pa ste 'bras bu'o //
translated: The great seal is the stage of completion, which is the result.

original: dam tshig phyag rgya ni mnyam gzhag dang rjes thob dang / chos sku dang gzugs sku gnyis su med cing zung du 'jug par ston pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi rim pa ste gzhan gyi don du byung ba'o //
analyzed: dam tshig phyag rgya ni mnyam gzhag dang rjes thob dang / chos sku dang gzugs sku gnyis su med cing zung du 'jug par ston pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi rim pa ste gzhan gyi don du byung ba'o //
translated: The pledge seal is the stage of reality, which is the benefit for others, and is the nonduality and union of the meditative equipoise and subsequent states, and of the two buddha bodies, the dharma body and the form body.

original: de la re zhig las kyi phyag rgya la lus rnam par dag par byed pa bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de la re zhig las kyi phyag rgya la lus rnam par dag par byed pa bstan par bya'o //
translated: Now, the action seal should be taught as the purification of the body.🔽In this regard, it is said:

original: de la / las kyi phyag rgya lus las byung //
analyzed: de la / las kyi phyag rgya lus las byung //
translated: The action seal arises from the body.

original: chos kyi phyag rgya ngag las te //
analyzed: chos kyi phyag rgya ngag las te //
translated: The dharma seal arises from speech.

original: phyag rgya chen po yid las so //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po yid las so //
translated: The great seal arises from the mind.

original: dam tshig phyag rgya kun du 'gro / zhes gsungs @174a * //
analyzed: dam tshig phyag rgya kun du 'gro / zhes gsungs @174a * //
translated: The pledge seal is omnipresent.

original: pa ni lus kyi las so //
analyzed: pa ni lus kyi las so //
translated: This is the action of the body.

original: phyag rgya ni des mtshon par byed pas so //
analyzed: phyag rgya ni des mtshon par byed pas so //
translated: The seal is so called because it is impressed by that.

original: las kyi phyag rgya de yang gsum ste /
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya de yang gsum ste /
translated: The action seal is also threefold:

original: drag po'i dbang dang / dbang bskur ngan pa dang / yang dag pa'i dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: drag po'i dbang dang / dbang bskur ngan pa dang / yang dag pa'i dbang bskur ro //
translated: the violent initiation, the bad initiation, and the right initiation.

original: de la drag po'i dbang ni phyi rol gyi'o byed pa dang 'khyud pa la sogs pa'i cha'i skabs su gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rtog pa yod pa la rnam pa sna tshogs kyi skad cig ma ste dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de la drag po'i dbang ni phyi rol gyi'o byed pa dang 'khyud pa la sogs pa'i cha'i skabs su gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rtog pa yod pa la rnam pa sna tshogs kyi skad cig ma ste dga' ba'o //
translated: The violent initiation is the outer one, in the case of the parts of copulation and embrace, etc., where there is the concept of subject and object, and the moment of the various kinds of joy.

original: de la srub dang bsrub pa'i sbyor ba la phyi gzung ba'i rtog pas stong la nang 'dzin pa'i shes pa ni rnam par smin pa'i skad cig ma ste mchog tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de la srub dang bsrub pa'i sbyor ba la phyi gzung ba'i rtog pas stong la nang 'dzin pa'i shes pa ni rnam par smin pa'i skad cig ma ste mchog tu dga' ba'o //
translated: In the case of the union of the male and female in the act of copulation, the subject is empty of the concept of the outer object, and the consciousness of the inner subject is the moment of the maturation, which is supreme joy.

original: byang chub kyi sems nor ngu'o grong du phyin pa las gzung 'dzin gyis stong pa'i shes pa yongs su grub pa ni rnam par nyed pa'i skad cig ma ste dga' bral lo //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems nor ngu'o grong du phyin pa las gzung 'dzin gyis stong pa'i shes pa yongs su grub pa ni rnam par nyed pa'i skad cig ma ste dga' bral lo //
translated: When the bodhisattva semen is lost in the town, the consciousness empty of subject and object is the absolute, which is the moment of the dissolution, which is the joyless.

analyzed: de nas byang chub kyi sems ltung ba las gzung 'dzin gyi shes pa rtog pa dang bcas pa ni mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i skad cig ma ste /

analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //

translated: Thus, one should understand that thought and nonthought are the same in suchness.

original: 'o na de lta na /
analyzed: 'o na de lta na /
translated: Well then, if that is so,

original: mchog dang dga' bral dbus su ni //
analyzed: mchog dang dga' bral dbus su ni //
translated: in the middle of the supreme and the separation from joy,

original: mtshon bya shes nas brtag par gyis //
analyzed: mtshon bya shes nas brtag par gyis //
translated: having understood the illustration, examine.

original: zhes gsungs pas ni mchog dga' dang dga' bral gyi dbus su lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba mtshon nas 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas ni mchog dga' dang dga' bral gyi dbus su lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba mtshon nas 'dor ba'o //

original: des na khyod kyi gzhung dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: des na khyod kyi gzhung dang 'gal lo //

original: de yang drag po'i gzhung gis 'di ltar 'dod de /
analyzed: de yang drag po'i gzhung gis 'di ltar 'dod de /
translated: Moreover, the scriptures of Drahama accept this:

original: sgra'i nges par gzung ba drug pas gnyis kyi bar nas gang gtso bor gyur pa gzung ba ste /
analyzed: sgra'i nges par gzung ba drug pas gnyis kyi bar nas gang gtso bor gyur pa gzung ba ste /
translated: The sixth case, the genitive, is used to indicate that which is primary between two things.

original: mchog dga' dang dga' bral gnyis kyi nang dam dbus nas gtso bor gyur ba ni dga' bral lo //
analyzed: mchog dga' dang dga' bral gnyis kyi nang dam dbus nas gtso bor gyur ba ni dga' bral lo //
translated: The inner and central of the two, supreme joy and the separation from joy, is the separation from joy.

original: de bas na dga' bral nyid gtso bo yin zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na dga' bral nyid gtso bo yin zhe na /
translated: Therefore, if you ask, “Is the separation from joy the principal one?”

original: mchog gi mtha' dang dga' bral dbus //
analyzed: mchog gi mtha' dang dga' bral dbus //
translated: The end of supreme joy and the middle of the separation from joy🔽are the empty and nonempty herukas.

original: stong dang stong min he ru ka / zhes gsungs pas lhan cig skyes pa ni mchog dga' dang dga' bral gnyis kyi dbus su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: stong dang stong min he ru ka / zhes gsungs pas lhan cig skyes pa ni mchog dga' dang dga' bral gnyis kyi dbus su shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, you should understand that the connate is in the middle of the two, supreme joy and the separation from joy.

original: yang drag po'i sbyor ba'i gzhung gis de lta bu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yang drag po'i sbyor ba'i gzhung gis de lta bu ni ma yin te /
translated: Also, it is not like that according to the text of the practice of Caṇḍālī.

analyzed: 'di yang mchog tu dga' ba'i mtha' ma lhan cig skyes pa la ltos nas dang po dga' bral te /

original: des na dga' bral yang yin la dang po yang yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na dga' bral yang yin la dang po yang yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is the separation from joy and it is the beginning.🔽The supreme nature of the connate

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin mchog / mtha' dga' dang po nyid dang ni //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin mchog / mtha' dga' dang po nyid dang ni //
translated: is the end of joy and the beginning.

original: mun pa la ni mar me @174b ltar ;
analyzed: mun pa la ni mar me @174b ltar ;
translated: Like a lamp in the darkness,

original: / de bzhin bus kyang yid ches gyis //
analyzed: / de bzhin bus kyang yid ches gyis //
translated: you should also have confidence in the son.

original: zhes gsungs pa ni lhan cig skyes pa rdo rje 'chang gi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa ni lhan cig skyes pa rdo rje 'chang gi ngo bo ste /
translated: This is the essence of the simultaneously born Vajradhara.

original: dper na mar mes mun ba bcom nas gsal bar byas pa bzhin du mtshon byed dpe'i lhan cig skyes bas ma rig pa'i mun ba bcom ste /
analyzed: dper na mar mes mun ba bcom nas gsal bar byas pa bzhin du mtshon byed dpe'i lhan cig skyes bas ma rig pa'i mun ba bcom ste /
translated: Just as a butter lamp dispels darkness and illuminates, the simultaneously born example simultaneously destroys the darkness of ignorance and illuminates.🔽The simultaneously born meaning, which is the object of illustration, is illuminated.

original: mtshon bya don gyi lhan cig skyes pa gsal bar byed pa ni mchog tu dga' ba'i mtha' ma dga' bral /
analyzed: mtshon bya don gyi lhan cig skyes pa gsal bar byed pa ni mchog tu dga' ba'i mtha' ma dga' bral /
translated: The end of supreme joy is the joy of separation.

original: dga' bral gyi dang por lhan cig skyes pa shes par bya'o //🔽gzhan yang / 'khyud dang 'o byed la sogs pa //
analyzed: dga' bral gyi dang por lhan cig skyes pa shes par bya'o // gzhan yang / 'khyud dang 'o byed la sogs pa //
translated: In the beginning of the joy of separation, one should understand the simultaneously born.🔽Further,

original: sna tshogs rnam pas sna tshogs bshad //
analyzed: sna tshogs rnam pas sna tshogs bshad //
translated: the various explanations are by various means, such as embracing and kissing.

original: rnam par smin pa de las bzlog / bde ba'i ye shes za ba nyid //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa de las bzlog / bde ba'i ye shes za ba nyid //
translated: The opposite of that is the enjoyment of the gnosis of bliss.

original: bdag gis bde ba zos ba yi //
analyzed: bdag gis bde ba zos ba yi //
translated: The taste of one’s own bliss

original: ros ni rnam par nyed pa brjod //
analyzed: ros ni rnam par nyed pa brjod //
translated: is said to be the melting.

original: mtshan nyid bral ba gsum la las gzhan //
analyzed: mtshan nyid bral ba gsum la las gzhan //

original: chags dang chags bral rnam par spangs //
analyzed: chags dang chags bral rnam par spangs //
translated: Free from attachment and nonattachment,

analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i tshig gis ni gong du gsungs pa lhan cig skyes pa zos pa ni nyams su myong ba ste /
translated: The words of this passage indicate that the previously mentioned connate joy is experienced.

original: phyis bzhi pa dga' bral gyi dus na grogs ni gong ma la rtog cing dpyod pa ste /
analyzed: phyis bzhi pa dga' bral gyi dus na grogs ni gong ma la rtog cing dpyod pa ste /
translated: Later, at the time of the fourth joy of separation, the companion is the investigation and analysis of the former.

original: rtog pa nyid yin gyis mi rtog par grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa nyid yin gyis mi rtog par grub pa ma yin no //
translated: It is conceptual, not nonconceptual.

original: yang drag po'i sbyor ba'i gzhung gis rnam par nyed pa nyid rtog pa dang bcas pa yin yang gnod par mi 'gyur te bsgrub par bya ba dga' bral ni mi rtog pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yang drag po'i sbyor ba'i gzhung gis rnam par nyed pa nyid rtog pa dang bcas pa yin yang gnod par mi 'gyur te bsgrub par bya ba dga' bral ni mi rtog pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Again, one might say that although the moment of complete joy is conceptual, it is not harmed by that, because the object to be accomplished, the joy of separation, is nonconceptual.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /

analyzed: sna tshogs dang po dga' ba nyid // rnam smin la ni mchog dga' nyid //
translated: The first is the diversity itself,🔽the full ripening is supreme joy,

original: rnam nyed dga' bral dga' ba nyid //
analyzed: rnam nyed dga' bral dga' ba nyid //
translated: complete joy is the joy of separation,

original: mtshan bral lhan cig skyes pa nyid //
analyzed: mtshan bral lhan cig skyes pa nyid //
translated: the signless is the connate.

analyzed: ces gsungs pa des dga' bral ni rnam par nyed pa'i skad cig ma nyid du gsungs so //
translated: This passage states that the joy of separation is the moment of complete joy.

analyzed: rnam par nyed pa rtog pa dang bcas pa yin pas dga' bral yang rtog pa dang bcas pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Since the state of complete joy is associated with conceptual thought, the state of separation from joy should be understood as being associated with conceptual thought.

original: de bzhin du gzhan yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: dang por dga' ba 'gro ba'i gzugs //
analyzed: dang por dga' ba 'gro ba'i gzugs //
translated: the first is the form of going to joy,

original: de bzhin mchog dga' 'gro pa nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin mchog dga' 'gro pa nyid //
translated: and likewise, the supreme joy is the going itself,

original: dga' bral dga' 'gro ba nyid //
analyzed: dga' bral dga' 'gro ba nyid //
translated: the separation from joy is the going itself,

original: gsum pa lhan cig skyes pa med //
analyzed: gsum pa lhan cig skyes pa med //
translated: but the third is not the innate.

original: ces bya ba yang gnod pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba yang gnod pa ste /
translated: This is also a refutation.

original: 'gro ba ni 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni 'khor ba'o //
translated: Going is samsara.

original: 'khor ba ni rtog pa'i ngo bo 'khrul pa yin pas na dga' bral yang rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba ni rtog pa'i ngo bo 'khrul pa yin pas na dga' bral yang rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: Since samsara is a mistake that has the nature of conceptual thought, the state of separation from joy should be understood as being associated with conceptual thought.

original: des na drag po'i gzhung gis bsgrub bya dga' bral nyid kyang nyams par 'gyur ro //🔽des na dga' bral gyi dga' ba brgyud nas grangs kyi gsum pa la @175a * //
analyzed: des na drag po'i gzhung gis bsgrub bya dga' bral nyid kyang nyams par 'gyur ro // des na dga' bral gyi dga' ba brgyud nas grangs kyi gsum pa la @175a * //
translated: Therefore, the thesis of the Bhavasamkranti that the state of separation from joy is to be accomplished is undermined.

original: bshad kyang don gyis bzhi pa la go bar bya'o //
analyzed: bshad kyang don gyis bzhi pa la go bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, although the joy of separation from joy is explained as the third in the enumeration, it should be understood as the fourth in fact.

analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa grangs kyi bzhi pa la bshad kyang don gyis gsum pa la rig par bya'o //
translated: Although the fourth of the four enumerations is explained as the connate, in fact it should be understood as the third.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir rgyud dag las yang dag dbang bskur gyi rim pa lhan cig skyes pa gsum pa la ma bshad pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir rgyud dag las yang dag dbang bskur gyi rim pa lhan cig skyes pa gsum pa la ma bshad pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Well then, why is the connate not explained as the third in the stages of the perfect empowerment in the tantras?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: glegs bam la mkhas pa phyi rol la sogs pa'i mkhas pa rnams bla ma la mi ltos par sgra yis tshig gtan la phab ste /
analyzed: glegs bam la mkhas pa phyi rol la sogs pa'i mkhas pa rnams bla ma la mi ltos par sgra yis tshig gtan la phab ste /

analyzed: tshad ma'i don gtan la phab nas sngags kyi don zab mo dbang za bar byed pa de rnams dgag pa'i phyir rgyud du dkrugs pa'o //
translated: who determine the meaning of logic, and who consume the profound meaning of mantra, the tantras are mixed up.

original: bla ma la ma ltos na skyen cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bla ma la ma ltos na skyen cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one does not rely on a guru, what happens?

original: de yang 'di skad du /
analyzed: de yang 'di skad du /
translated: It is said:

analyzed: dngos grub bla ma'i rjes 'brangs gsungs //

analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / bla ma mnyes byas yang dag 'dod pa bla //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: The guru is pleased, and the desired object is perfect.

translated: Now, moreover, the bad consecration will be taught.

translated: Therein, the existence of the concepts of subject and object from external kissing and embracing is the various moments of joy.

original: de nas po la dang kakko la mnyam par sbyor ba las phyi gzung ba'i rtog pas stong la nang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo ni rnam par smin pa'i skad cig ma ste mchog tu dga' ba'o //

translated: Then, from the union of the bhaga and the kakkola, empty of the concept of external object, the nature of internal subject is the moment of maturation, supreme joy.

analyzed: rdo rje nor bu'i dkyil du kun rdzob kunda lta bu don dam pa bde ba'i rang bzhin gyis khyab pa'o //
translated: The relative, like a kunda flower, is pervaded by the ultimate, the nature of bliss, in the center of the vajra jewel.

translated: From the arrival of the bodhicitta, the mind empty of subject and object is the perfected consciousness itself, the moment free from characteristics, the joy of the connate.

translated: The moment of the dissolution of the consciousness of the object and subject is the joy of separation from joy.

analyzed: bzhi pa de yang de bzhin no //

original: zab mo bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: zab mo bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbugs dbyung ba yang rnam par rig pa tsam du 'dod pa ste dman pa'o //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: de bas na mu stegs pa dang thun mong gi grub mtha' ste /

analyzed: des na dbang bskur ba'am dman pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called an initiation or a lesser one.

analyzed: de bas na drang ba'i don yin gyi nges pa'i don ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is of provisional meaning, not of definitive meaning.

analyzed: de nas gzhan yang nges pa'i don yang dag pa'i dbang bskur ba'i rim ba rdo rje 'chang gi dbugs dbyung ba bstan par bya ste /
translated: Now, moreover, I will explain the stage of the perfect empowerment of the definitive meaning, the solace of Vajradhara.

analyzed: stong pa ma yin pa ni mi bskyod pa'i thig le'i rgya dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The non-empty is sealed with the drop of Akshobhya.

original: de bas na zung du 'jug pa ste he ru ka'o //
analyzed: de bas na zung du 'jug pa ste he ru ka'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the union, that is, Heruka.

original: de yang 'di skad du /
analyzed: de yang 'di skad du /
translated: And it is said:

original: shr'i ni gnyis med ye shes te //
analyzed: shr'i ni gnyis med ye shes te //
translated: Śrī is nondual intuition.

original: he ni rgyu stsogs stong pa nyid //
analyzed: he ni rgyu stsogs stong pa nyid //
translated: He is the voidness of causes, etc.

original: ru ni tshogs dang bral ba nyid//
analyzed: ru ni tshogs dang bral ba nyid//
translated: Ru is the absence of a collection.

original: ka ni gang du'ang mi gnas pa'o //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ka ni gang du'ang mi gnas pa'o // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Ka is not located anywhere.

original: des na shr'i ni gnyis su med pa ste //
analyzed: des na shr'i ni gnyis su med pa ste //
translated: Thus, Śrī is nondual.

original: de ni he ru ka'o //
analyzed: de ni he ru ka'o //
translated: That is Heruka.

original: he ni he tu yo ga zhes bya ste /
analyzed: he ni he tu yo ga zhes bya ste /
translated: He is hetu, yoga.

original: rgyu med pas na ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu med pas na ma skyes pa'o //
translated: Since it is causeless, it is unproduced.

original: ru ni ru pa ka zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ru ni ru pa ka zhes bya ste /
translated: Ru is rūpaka.

original: rang bzhin med pa'am /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'am /
translated: It is without intrinsic reality,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i tshogs dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i tshogs dang bral ba'o //
translated: or it is free from the collection of conceptual thoughts.

original: ka ni ka ko ti sti zhes bya @177b ste /
analyzed: ka ni ka ko ti sti zhes bya @177b ste /
translated: Ka is kakotīsti.

original: tag chad la sogs pa'i mtha' gang la yang mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: tag chad la sogs pa'i mtha' gang la yang mi gnas pa'o //
translated: It is not located in any extreme, such as nihilism.

original: de lta bu'i zung du 'jug pa gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i skad cig ma la lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i zung du 'jug pa gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i skad cig ma la lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: Thus, the innate is in the moment free from the characteristics of the union, nonduality.

original: de nas byang chub kyi sems khu ba ltung bar gyur pa las bde ba nyams pa ste /🔽gzung 'dzin gyi rtog pa dang bcas bar gyur pa la rnam par nyed pa'i skad cig ma ste /
analyzed: de nas byang chub kyi sems khu ba ltung bar gyur pa las bde ba nyams pa ste / gzung 'dzin gyi rtog pa dang bcas bar gyur pa la rnam par nyed pa'i skad cig ma ste /
translated: Then, the bodhicitta falls, and the bliss declines.

original: dga' bral gyi dga' ba'o //
analyzed: dga' bral gyi dga' ba'o //
translated: The moment of dissolution is the bliss of separation from joy, which is accompanied by the concepts of subject and object.

original: dga' bral ni dga' ba rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa mi rtog pa gnyis gnyis su med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dga' bral ni dga' ba rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa mi rtog pa gnyis gnyis su med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The bliss of separation from joy is taught to be nondual with the connate joy that is free of concepts.

original: bzhi pa de yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa de yang de bzhin no //
translated: The fourth is also like that.

original: zhes gsungs pas bzhi pa ni dga' bral lo //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas bzhi pa ni dga' bral lo //
translated: The fourth is the bliss of separation from joy.

original: de zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: That is the connate joy.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni dga' bral gyi dga' ba'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni dga' bral gyi dga' ba'o //
translated: Also refers to the bliss of separation from joy.

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rigs pas dpyad na mtha' bzhi las grol ba mi rtog par bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rigs pas dpyad na mtha' bzhi las grol ba mi rtog par bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the bliss of separation from joy, which is accompanied by concepts, is like the connate joy, which is free of concepts, when analyzed with reasoning.

original: de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dga' bral gyi dga' ba rtog pa dang bcas pa yang lhan cig skyes pa mi rtog pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dga' bral gyi dga' ba rtog pa dang bcas pa yang lhan cig skyes pa mi rtog pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: Also like that means that the bliss of separation from joy, which is accompanied by concepts, should be understood to be like the connate joy, which is free of concepts.

original: de bas na rtog pa dang mi rtog pa gnyis ni tha mi dad par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rtog pa dang mi rtog pa gnyis ni tha mi dad par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that thought and non-thought are not different.

original: rdo rje 'chang gi dbugs dbyung ba rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang gi dbugs dbyung ba rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The completion stage is the consolation of Vajradhara.

original: las kyi phyag rgya'i dga' ba rnams lhan cig skyes par ro gcig ste /
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya'i dga' ba rnams lhan cig skyes par ro gcig ste /
translated: The joys of the karma-mudra are of one taste in the co-emergent.

original: de yang 'di skad du /
analyzed: de yang 'di skad du /
translated: Moreover, it is said:

original: dga' ba chen po gcig nyid la //
analyzed: dga' ba chen po gcig nyid la //
translated: In the one great joy

original: phye bas rnam ba bzhi ru 'gyur //
analyzed: phye bas rnam ba bzhi ru 'gyur //
translated: The divisions are four.

original: zha'o // de bas na dga' ba rnams ni ngo bo gcig pa ste /
analyzed: zha'o // de bas na dga' ba rnams ni ngo bo gcig pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the joys are of one nature.

original: ma rtogs pa'i gang zag la de rtogs par bya ba'i phyir las kyi phyag rgya bstan pa las bde ba mi rtog pa skyes pa dang rtogs pa stong pa'i sems kyi khyad par gyi skad cig ma ste /
analyzed: ma rtogs pa'i gang zag la de rtogs par bya ba'i phyir las kyi phyag rgya bstan pa las bde ba mi rtog pa skyes pa dang rtogs pa stong pa'i sems kyi khyad par gyi skad cig ma ste /
translated: For the person who has not realized that, in order to realize it, the karma-mudra is taught. The non-conceptual bliss that arises from that and the special moment of the mind that is empty of conceptualization

original: skad cig mas phye bas dga' ba bzhi'o //
analyzed: skad cig mas phye bas dga' ba bzhi'o //
translated: are divided by moments, and so there are four joys.

original: des na dga' ba thams cad skad cig ste /
analyzed: des na dga' ba thams cad skad cig ste /
translated: Therefore, all joys are momentary.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the result that is similar to the cause.

original: dpe las kyi phyag rgya mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dpe las kyi phyag rgya mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: The example of the karma-mudra is taught in brief.

original: las kyi phyag rgya bcos ma las ma bcos pa'i phyag rgya chen po mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya bcos ma las ma bcos pa'i phyag rgya chen po mi 'byung ste /
translated: The great seal does not arise from an artificial karmamudra, but from an uncontrived karmamudra.

original: dra ba'i rgyu las 'dra ba'i 'bras bu 'byung ste /
analyzed: dra ba'i rgyu las 'dra ba'i 'bras bu 'byung ste /
translated: A net arises from the cause of a net, not from fire.

original: me 'dra ba las ma yin pa bzhin du chos kyi phyag rgya ma bcos pa las phyag rgya chen po 'byung gi / bcos ma las kyi phyag rgya las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: me 'dra ba las ma yin pa bzhin du chos kyi phyag rgya ma bcos pa las phyag rgya chen po 'byung gi / bcos ma las kyi phyag rgya las ni ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, the great seal arises from an uncontrived dharma mudra, not from a contrived karmamudra.

original: de yang 'di skad du /
analyzed: de yang 'di skad du /
translated: It is said:

original: mi yi phyag rgya dang gis 'jig / de yi ye shes kyang ni 'jig / ces gsungs so //
analyzed: mi yi phyag rgya dang gis 'jig / de yi ye shes kyang ni 'jig / ces gsungs so //
translated: The human mudra is naturally destroyed, and also its wisdom is destroyed.

original: des na las kyi phyag rgya las ni ma yin no //🔽de nas gzhan yang chos kyi @178a * //
analyzed: des na las kyi phyag rgya las ni ma yin no // de nas gzhan yang chos kyi @178a * //
translated: Therefore, it is not from a karmamudra.

original: phyag rgya bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya bstan par bya ste /
translated: Next, the dharma mudra will be explained.

original: de la chos kyi phyag rgya'i rang gi ngo bo ni chos kyi phung po dang khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa 'gro ba sna tshogs yin la /
analyzed: de la chos kyi phyag rgya'i rang gi ngo bo ni chos kyi phung po dang khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa 'gro ba sna tshogs yin la /
translated: The essence of the dharma mudra is the various dharmas, such as the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: phyag rgya ni de dag gi rang bzhin lhan cig skyes pa las ma 'das pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya ni de dag gi rang bzhin lhan cig skyes pa las ma 'das pa'o //
translated: The mudra is the innate nature of those that does not go beyond that.

original: de la re zhig dpe las kyi phyag rgya la dga' ba bzhi bstan pa bzhin du lam chos kyi phyag rgya la yang dga' ba bzhir shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la re zhig dpe las kyi phyag rgya la dga' ba bzhi bstan pa bzhin du lam chos kyi phyag rgya la yang dga' ba bzhir shes par bya'o //
translated: In this regard, just as the four joys are taught in the example of the karmamudra, one should understand that the four joys are also in the path of the dharmamudra.

original: de la dga' ba bzhi ni dpe las kyi phyag rgya las skad cig ma gsum pa la mtshon byed dpe'i lhan cig skyes pa nyams su myong ba ji lta ba des mtshon bya don gyi lhan cig skyes pa ste /
analyzed: de la dga' ba bzhi ni dpe las kyi phyag rgya las skad cig ma gsum pa la mtshon byed dpe'i lhan cig skyes pa nyams su myong ba ji lta ba des mtshon bya don gyi lhan cig skyes pa ste /
translated: The four joys are as follows: Just as the illustrated example of the connate state is experienced in the third moment of the example of the karmamudra, the illustrated meaning of the connate state is as follows.

original: de 'di skad du /
analyzed: de 'di skad du /
translated: It is said:

original: lha dang mi yi bde ba yis //🔽bsdus byas rdo rje 'dzin pa yi //
analyzed: lha dang mi yi bde ba yis // bsdus byas rdo rje 'dzin pa yi //
translated: The bliss of gods and humans

original: bcu drug char yang mi phod do //
analyzed: bcu drug char yang mi phod do //
translated: does not equal one-sixteenth🔽of the vajra holder.🔽Thus, the nonconceptual gnosis of the illustrated meaning of the connate state is superior to the illustrated example of the connate state experienced in the karmamudra.

original: zhes gsungs pas las kyi phyag rgya las mtshon byed dpe'i lhan cig skyes pa nyams su myong ba las khyad par du 'phags pa'i mtshon bya don gyi lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes mi rtog pa gnyis su med pa nyid rkyen las dang ma rig pa'i stobs kyis
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas las kyi phyag rgya las mtshon byed dpe'i lhan cig skyes pa nyams su myong ba las khyad par du 'phags pa'i mtshon bya don gyi lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes mi rtog pa gnyis su med pa nyid rkyen las dang ma rig pa'i stobs kyis
translated: The nondual gnosis of the illustrated meaning of the connate state is the result of the power of the conditions of karma and ignorance.

original: ma rtogs kyang lhan cig skyes pa de nyid 'gro ba sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin du snang gi / de las gzhan pa rnams ma yin par shes pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i skad cig ma la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: ma rtogs kyang lhan cig skyes pa de nyid 'gro ba sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin du snang gi / de las gzhan pa rnams ma yin par shes pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i skad cig ma la dga' ba'o //
translated: This is the joy in the moment of the various aspects.

original: des na / 'khor ba spangs nas gzhan du ni //
analyzed: des na / 'khor ba spangs nas gzhan du ni //
translated: Thus it is said:

original: mya ngan 'das pa thob mi 'gyur //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa thob mi 'gyur //
translated: Nirvana is not attained elsewhere,🔽having abandoned samsara.

original: zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas /
translated: Therefore,

original: 'gro ba spangs pa'i pha rol nas lhan cig skyes pa rnyed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gro ba spangs pa'i pha rol nas lhan cig skyes pa rnyed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: the connate cannot be found on the other side of abandoning beings.🔽If one knows the nature of beings, that itself is the connate.🔽Therefore, in order to abandon the clinging that grasps beings, one should know the connate nature of beings.

original: 'gro ba'i rang bzhin yongs su shes na de nyid lhan cig skyes pa yin pas na 'gro bar 'dzin pa'i zhen pa spang ba'i phyir 'gro ba'i rang bzhin lhan cig skyes par shes nas de bzhin nyid la goms par byas na goms pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rang bzhin yongs su shes na de nyid lhan cig skyes pa yin pas na 'gro bar 'dzin pa'i zhen pa spang ba'i phyir 'gro ba'i rang bzhin lhan cig skyes par shes nas de bzhin nyid la goms par byas na goms pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa
translated: If one meditates on suchness, the culmination of familiarization

original: tsam na 'gro ba sna tshogs kyi zhen pa spangs nas thams cad lhan cig skyes par rtogs pa ni rnam par smin pa'i skad cig ma la mchog tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: tsam na 'gro ba sna tshogs kyi zhen pa spangs nas thams cad lhan cig skyes par rtogs pa ni rnam par smin pa'i skad cig ma la mchog tu dga' ba'o //
translated: At that time, having abandoned attachment to the various migrating beings, the realization that all are connate is the supreme joy on the instant of complete ripening.

original: 'gro ba sna tshogs kyi zhen pa spangs kyang lhan cig skyes pa'i 'dzin pa'i zhen pa phra mo yod pas de yang khyad par ma dmigs na dper na lcags las byas pa'i sgrog dang / gser las byas pa'i sgrog gnyis rgyu la khyad par yod kyang 'ching ba la khyad par med do //
analyzed: 'gro ba sna tshogs kyi zhen pa spangs kyang lhan cig skyes pa'i 'dzin pa'i zhen pa phra mo yod pas de yang khyad par ma dmigs na dper na lcags las byas pa'i sgrog dang / gser las byas pa'i sgrog gnyis rgyu la khyad par yod kyang 'ching ba la khyad par med do //
translated: Although attachment to the various migrating beings is abandoned, there is a subtle attachment to the connate apprehender. If that is not observed as different, for example, an iron chain and a golden chain have a difference in cause but are not different in bondage.

original: de bzhin du tha mal pa'i 'gro ba sna tshogs su 'dzin pa'i rtog pa dang / gya nom pa la lhan @178b cig skyes pa tsam du 'dzin pa'i rtog pa la bzang rtog ngan rtog khyad par yod kyang zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i zug rngu'i rang bzhin du khyad par med pas lhan cig skyes pa nyid du 'dzin pa'i zhen pa la 'jug🔽pa las slar ldog par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du tha mal pa'i 'gro ba sna tshogs su 'dzin pa'i rtog pa dang / gya nom pa la lhan @178b cig skyes pa tsam du 'dzin pa'i rtog pa la bzang rtog ngan rtog khyad par yod kyang zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i zug rngu'i rang bzhin du khyad par med pas lhan cig skyes pa nyid du 'dzin pa'i zhen pa la 'jug pa las slar ldog par bya ste /
translated: Likewise, the thought that apprehends the various ordinary beings and the thought that apprehends the sublime as merely coemergent are distinguished as good thoughts and bad thoughts, but they are not distinguished as to the nature of the pain of conceptual thoughts of clinging.

original: yang dag tu na 'gro ba spang bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: yang dag tu na 'gro ba spang bar bya ba'am /
translated: Therefore, one should turn away from the clinging that apprehends as coemergent.

original: lhan cig skyes pa bsgrub par bya bar ma grub ste /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa bsgrub par bya bar ma grub ste /
translated: In reality, there is no coemergent to be accomplished🔽or an ordinary being to be abandoned.

original: 'gro ba spangs pa las lhan cig skyes pa gzhan ma yid no //
analyzed: 'gro ba spangs pa las lhan cig skyes pa gzhan ma yid no //
translated: Coemergence is not something other than the abandonment of ordinary beings.

original: ma rtogs pa'i blo la tha dad du snang yang rtogs na 'gro ba nyid lhan cig skyes pa nyid 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa'i blo la tha dad du snang yang rtogs na 'gro ba nyid lhan cig skyes pa nyid 'gro ba'o //
translated: Although they appear as different to the mind that does not understand, when understood, ordinary beings themselves are coemergence.

original: de ltar 'gro pa dang lhan cig skyes pa gnyis kyi zhen pa spangs te gnyis su med pa'i shes pa zung du 'jug pa ni mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i skad cig ma la lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'gro pa dang lhan cig skyes pa gnyis kyi zhen pa spangs te gnyis su med pa'i shes pa zung du 'jug pa ni mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i skad cig ma la lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
translated: Thus, having abandoned the attachment of both the moving mind and the connate [mind], the nondual cognition that is united is the connate joy in the instant free from characteristics.

original: de ltar mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes pa la gnyis su med kyang rjes las thob pa la sna tshogs kyi rtog pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bcas pa ni rnam par nyed pa'i skad cig ma la dga' bral lo //
analyzed: de ltar mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes pa la gnyis su med kyang rjes las thob pa la sna tshogs kyi rtog pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bcas pa ni rnam par nyed pa'i skad cig ma la dga' bral lo //
translated: Thus, although there is no duality in the cognition of equipoise, the various thoughts in the post-equipoise state that are associated with percepts and perceivers are the separation from joy in the instant of withdrawal.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes pa dang / rjes la thob pa'i shes pa gnyis su bstan pa'i phyir /🔽bzhi pa de yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes pa dang / rjes la thob pa'i shes pa gnyis su bstan pa'i phyir / bzhi pa de yang de bzhin no //
translated: In order to demonstrate that there are two cognitions—the cognition of equipoise and the cognition of post-equipoise—

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: it is said, “The fourth is also like that.”

original: bzhi pa zhes bya ba ni dga' bral dang rjes thob po //
analyzed: bzhi pa zhes bya ba ni dga' bral dang rjes thob po //
translated: The fourth is the separation from joy and the post-equipoise state.

original: de ni lhan cig skyes pa ste /
analyzed: de ni lhan cig skyes pa ste /
translated: That is the connate joy,

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: which is the cognition of equipoise.

original: yang na rjes thob kyi rtog pa nyid mtha' bzhi las grol ba ste /
analyzed: yang na rjes thob kyi rtog pa nyid mtha' bzhi las grol ba ste /
translated: Alternatively, the thoughts of the post-equipoise state are free from the four extremes.

original: rang bzhin med pa'o //
