analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: It is devoid of intrinsic nature.

original: de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rjes thob kyi rtog pa yang mnyam gzhag gi rtog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rjes thob kyi rtog pa yang mnyam gzhag gi rtog pa bzhin no //
translated: So it is means that the conceptualization of the post-equipoise state is like the conceptualization of the equipoise state.

original: de bas na mnyam gzhag dang rjes thob gnyis su med de zung du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na mnyam gzhag dang rjes thob gnyis su med de zung du 'jug pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the equipoise state and the post-equipoise state are nondual, and they are united.

original: chos kyi phyag rgya'i dga' ba bzhi yang dgongs pa snga ma bzhin du dga' ba rnams gcig gi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: chos kyi phyag rgya'i dga' ba bzhi yang dgongs pa snga ma bzhin du dga' ba rnams gcig gi ngo bo ste /
translated: The four joys of the dharma mudra are also, as in the previous intention, the nature of one joy.

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: It is the ripened result.🔽And that is also said:

original: de yang / rgyu chung 'bras bu che ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de yang / rgyu chung 'bras bu che ba'i phyir //
translated: Because the cause is small and the result is great,

original: rnam par smin pa' rjes su brjod //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa' rjes su brjod //
translated: it is called the ripened result.

original: ce'o // de bas na rgyu las kyi phyag rgya bas dga' ba chung la 'bras bu phyag rgya chen po thob tu rung bas ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: ce'o // de bas na rgyu las kyi phyag rgya bas dga' ba chung la 'bras bu phyag rgya chen po thob tu rung bas ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: Therefore, the small joy from the cause, the karma mudra, is suitable to attain the great mudra as the result, which is the ripened result.

original: rnam par smin pa'i skad cig ma la mchog tu dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i skad cig ma la mchog tu dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The supreme joy is called the supreme joy on the instant of the ripened result.

original: lam chos kyi phyag rgya yongs su rdzogs pa'i rim pa mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lam chos kyi phyag rgya yongs su rdzogs pa'i rim pa mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: The path of the perfected stage of the dharma mudra is explained in brief.

original: chos kyi phyag rgya yang las kyi phyag rgya la ltos na ma bcos pa yin la /
analyzed: chos kyi phyag rgya yang las kyi phyag rgya la ltos na ma bcos pa yin la /
translated: The seal of phenomena is uncontrived in comparison with the karmamudra,

original: phyag rgya chen po la ltos na bcos ma yin te /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po la ltos na bcos ma yin te /
translated: but it is contrived in comparison with the mahamudra.🔽It is contrived because it is associated with

original: dgag pa dang sgrub pa @179a * //🔽dang bcas pa ste bcos ma'o //
analyzed: dgag pa dang sgrub pa @179a * // dang bcas pa ste bcos ma'o //
translated: negation and affirmation.

original: gzhan yang dpe las kyi phyag rgya las mtshon byed dpe'i lhan cig skyes pa nyams su myong ba yang mtshon bya don gyi lhan cig skyes pa nyams su myong ba med pas na phyag rgya chen po sgrub pa'i yan lag ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang dpe las kyi phyag rgya las mtshon byed dpe'i lhan cig skyes pa nyams su myong ba yang mtshon bya don gyi lhan cig skyes pa nyams su myong ba med pas na phyag rgya chen po sgrub pa'i yan lag ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, the illustrative coemergence experienced from the karmamudra is not the illustrative coemergence experienced from the mahamudra.

original: da ni phyag rgya chen po nyid bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni phyag rgya chen po nyid bstan par bya ste /
translated: Now, the mahamudra itself will be explained.

original: phyag rgya chen po'i rang gi ngo bo'i phyag rgya ni mi 'da' bas na phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i rang gi ngo bo'i phyag rgya ni mi 'da' bas na phyag rgya ste /
translated: The mahamudra is a seal because it is not transgressed.

original: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po chen po'i bka' rtags kyi phyag rgya las mtha' khob kyi rgyal phran dang blon po gang gis kyang 'da' mi nus pa bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po chen po'i bka' rtags kyi phyag rgya las mtha' khob kyi rgyal phran dang blon po gang gis kyang 'da' mi nus pa bzhin du /
translated: For example, just as the seal of the great chakravartin king's decree cannot be transgressed by any of the minor kings or ministers in the borderlands,

original: phyi nang gi chos sna tshogs pa rnams phyag rgya chen po lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes zung du 'jug pa'i ngo bo las mi 'da' bas na phyag rgya yin la /
analyzed: phyi nang gi chos sna tshogs pa rnams phyag rgya chen po lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes zung du 'jug pa'i ngo bo las mi 'da' bas na phyag rgya yin la /
translated: Since the various outer and inner phenomena do not go beyond the essence of the unified pristine consciousness of the spontaneously present mahāmudrā, it is a mudrā.

original: chen po ni las kyi phyag rgya dang / chos kyi phyag rgya dang / dam tshig gi phyag rgya gsum gyi ngo bo yin pas na chen po'o //
analyzed: chen po ni las kyi phyag rgya dang / chos kyi phyag rgya dang / dam tshig gi phyag rgya gsum gyi ngo bo yin pas na chen po'o //
translated: Since it is the essence of the three—the karmamudrā, the samayamudrā, and the dharmamudrā—it is mahā.

original: ci phyag rgya chen po la yang dga' ba bzhir dbye'am ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci phyag rgya chen po la yang dga' ba bzhir dbye'am ci zhe na /
translated: If it is asked whether the four joys are differentiated in mahāmudrā,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: phyag rgya gsum la dga' ba bzhir dbye'i phyag rgya chen po la ma yin no //
analyzed: phyag rgya gsum la dga' ba bzhir dbye'i phyag rgya chen po la ma yin no //
translated: The four joys are differentiated in the three mudrās, but not in mahāmudrā.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If it is asked why,

original: phyag rgya chen po ni dri ma dang bral ba'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po ni dri ma dang bral ba'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: mahāmudrā is the result free of taints.

original: de bas na skad cig ma gsum dri ma dang bcas pa 'dir mi 'byung bas des phye ba'i dga' ba gsum yang 'dir mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na skad cig ma gsum dri ma dang bcas pa 'dir mi 'byung bas des phye ba'i dga' ba gsum yang 'dir mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, since the three moments with taints do not occur here, the three joys differentiated by those do not occur here.

original: des na dga' ba bzhir mi dbye'o //
analyzed: des na dga' ba bzhir mi dbye'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not differentiated into four joys.

original: rgyu mtshan yang phyag rgya chen po ni 'bras bu lam du byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan yang phyag rgya chen po ni 'bras bu lam du byed pa'o //
translated: The reason is that mahāmudrā is the path of fruition.

original: 'bras bu ni phyag rgya chen po ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni phyag rgya chen po ste /
translated: The fruition is mahāmudrā.

original: dngos po'i de kho na ji lta bar rtog pa de nyid de /
analyzed: dngos po'i de kho na ji lta bar rtog pa de nyid de /
translated: It is the realization of the thatness of entities just as it is.

original: de la dgag pa dang sgrub pa med de /
analyzed: de la dgag pa dang sgrub pa med de /
translated: It is free from negation and affirmation.

original: de bas na dga' ba bzhi ru mi dbye'o //
analyzed: de bas na dga' ba bzhi ru mi dbye'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not divided into four joys.

original: de yang 'di skad du /
analyzed: de yang 'di skad du /
translated: Moreover, it is said:

original: skad cig gcig gis rdzogs sangs rgyas //
analyzed: skad cig gcig gis rdzogs sangs rgyas //
translated: In a single instant, perfect buddhahood.

original: zhes gsungs pas gang gi tshe ma rtogs na 'khor ba yin la /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas gang gi tshe ma rtogs na 'khor ba yin la /
translated: When that is not realized, it is saṃsāra.

original: rtogs na de nyid phyag rgya chen po yin la dgag bya dang bsgrub bya med do //
analyzed: rtogs na de nyid phyag rgya chen po yin la dgag bya dang bsgrub bya med do //
translated: When it is realized, that itself is mahāmudrā, free from negandum and object of affirmation.

original: des na dga' ba bzhi ru dbye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na dga' ba bzhi ru dbye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not divided into four joys.

original: de la phyag rgya chen po ni gnyen po dang / de kho na nyid dang / 'bras bu gsum la re ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de la phyag rgya chen po ni gnyen po dang / de kho na nyid dang / 'bras bu gsum la re ba med pa'o //
translated: Mahāmudrā is free from the three hopes: for an antidote, for reality, and for a result.

original: de la gnyen po la re ba med pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna dang / 'chal ba'i tshul khrims dang / khong khro dang / le lo dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / ma rig pa spang ba'i phyir gnyen po'i phyogs pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis spang bya spong byed gang la yang zhen pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnyen po la re ba med pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna dang / 'chal ba'i tshul khrims dang / khong khro dang / le lo dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / ma rig pa spang ba'i phyir gnyen po'i phyogs pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis spang bya spong byed gang la yang zhen pa med pa'o //
translated: The absence of hope in the antidote is the absence of attachment to the abandonment of the objects to be abandoned and the antidotes, such as the six perfections, in order to abandon the discordant classes of stinginess, immorality, anger, laziness, distraction, and ignorance.

original: @179b de kho na nyid la re ba med pa ni de kho na gang gis thar ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa thob par byed do snyam pa'i zhen pa med pa'o //
analyzed: @179b de kho na nyid la re ba med pa ni de kho na gang gis thar ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa thob par byed do snyam pa'i zhen pa med pa'o //
translated: The absence of hope in reality is the absence of attachment to the thought, By this reality, I will attain liberation and omniscience.

original: 'bras bu la re ba med pa ni 'khor ba las gzhan pa'i phyag rgya chen po thob par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa'i zhen pa'i rtog pa med pa ni phyag rgya chen po ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu la re ba med pa ni 'khor ba las gzhan pa'i phyag rgya chen po thob par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa'i zhen pa'i rtog pa med pa ni phyag rgya chen po ste /
translated: The absence of hope in the result is the absence of the conceptual attachment that thinks, By this, I will attain mahāmudrā, which is different from samsara.

original: de nyid don lnga dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid don lnga dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Mahāmudrā is endowed with those five topics.

original: lnga ni ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa dang / rang bzhin med pa dang / thams cad du khyab pa dang / mi 'gyur ba dang / dus thams cad pa'o //
analyzed: lnga ni ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa dang / rang bzhin med pa dang / thams cad du khyab pa dang / mi 'gyur ba dang / dus thams cad pa'o //
translated: The five are: not arisen by own nature, not having a nature, pervading all, unchanging, and being in all times.

original: de la ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa ni chos thams cad sems las phyi rol gyi don logs su ma grub pa ste /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa ni chos thams cad sems las phyi rol gyi don logs su ma grub pa ste /
translated: Among them, not arisen by own nature means that all phenomena are not established as external objects apart from the mind.

original: rigs pas brtags na phyi'i don gcig kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs pas brtags na phyi'i don gcig kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: When examined with reasoning, not even one external object exists.

original: 'o na snang ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na snang ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Well then, why do they appear?

original: sems nyid las dang ma rig pa'i dbang gis sna tshogs su snang ngo //
analyzed: sems nyid las dang ma rig pa'i dbang gis sna tshogs su snang ngo //
translated: They appear as various things due to the power of karma and ignorance within the mind itself.

original: des na sems las gzhan pa phyi rol gyi don yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na sems las gzhan pa phyi rol gyi don yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, external objects that are other than the mind do not exist.

original: sems nyid rab tu snang ba'o //
analyzed: sems nyid rab tu snang ba'o //
translated: The mind itself appears.

original: sems nyid kyang yang dag par brtags na rang rig pa nyams su myong ba nyid rkyen gzhan la rag las nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ste skye ba'i phyir yang dag par na ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: sems nyid kyang yang dag par brtags na rang rig pa nyams su myong ba nyid rkyen gzhan la rag las nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ste skye ba'i phyir yang dag par na ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa'o //
translated: When the mind itself is properly examined, it is self-awareness, which is experienced as dependent origination, arising in dependence on other conditions. Therefore, in reality, it is not arisen by own nature.

original: de yang / gang gi rkyen las skyes pa de ma skyes //
analyzed: de yang / gang gi rkyen las skyes pa de ma skyes //
translated: That which arises from conditions does not arise.

original: de las skyes pa'i rang bzhin yod ma yin //
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i rang bzhin yod ma yin //
translated: It does not have a nature that arises from that.

original: rkyen la rag las gang de stong pa ste //
analyzed: rkyen la rag las gang de stong pa ste //
translated: That which depends on conditions is empty.

original: gang gis stong nyid shes de bag yod yin //
analyzed: gang gis stong nyid shes de bag yod yin //
translated: One who knows emptiness is heedful.

original: zhes gsungs pas sems nyid kyang rkyen gzhan la rag las nas nyams su myong ba skye bas na rang gi ngo bos ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas sems nyid kyang rkyen gzhan la rag las nas nyams su myong ba skye bas na rang gi ngo bos ma skyes pa'o //
translated: Since the experience of mind itself arises in dependence on other conditions, it does not arise by its own nature.

original: gzhan yang yod pa dang med pa gnyis ka las skye ba mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gzhan yang yod pa dang med pa gnyis ka las skye ba mi 'thad do //
translated: Moreover, arising from both the existent and the nonexistent is untenable.

original: yod pa skye na sngar skyes pa yang skye la /
analyzed: yod pa skye na sngar skyes pa yang skye la /
translated: If the existent arises, then what has already arisen would arise again.

original: med pa skye na nam mkha'i me tog kyang skye bar thal bas so //
analyzed: med pa skye na nam mkha'i me tog kyang skye bar thal bas so //
translated: If the nonexistent arises, then it follows that even a sky flower would arise.

original: de bas na ma skyes pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi skye ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ma skyes pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi skye ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which does not arise does not have inherently existent arising.

original: rang bzhin med pa ni yod pa dang med pa dang / gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka med pa'i ngo bor mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa ni yod pa dang med pa dang / gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka med pa'i ngo bor mi gnas pa'o //
translated: That which is essenceless does not abide in the nature of the existent, the nonexistent, both, or neither.

original: de la yod pa ma yin pa ni gcig dang du ma la sogs pa'i rigs bas brtags na gang gi ngo bor yang ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la yod pa ma yin pa ni gcig dang du ma la sogs pa'i rigs bas brtags na gang gi ngo bor yang ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Non-existence is not, because when it is investigated by the principles of one, many, etc., it is not established as any nature at all.

original: med pa ma yin pa ni nyams su myong ba yod pa'i phyir dang / med pa'i dgag bya grub pa'o //
analyzed: med pa ma yin pa ni nyams su myong ba yod pa'i phyir dang / med pa'i dgag bya grub pa'o //
translated: Non-non-existence is not, because experience exists and because the negatee of non-existence is established.

original: gnyis ka ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: gnyis ka ma yin pa ni /
translated: Neither of the two is, because

original: yod pa'i dngos po nyid la rang bzhin med de /
analyzed: yod pa'i dngos po nyid la rang bzhin med de /
translated: the existent thing itself has no intrinsic reality.

original: de las gzhan pa'i med pa mi 'grub la /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i med pa mi 'grub la /
translated: The non-existence which is other than that is not established.

original: rang bzhin med pa ma grub pa nyid snang gi / rigs pas grub pa snang ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa ma grub pa nyid snang gi / rigs pas grub pa snang ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The non-establishment of intrinsic reality itself appears, but the establishment by reasoning does not appear.

original: des na snang ba @180a * //
analyzed: des na snang ba @180a * //
translated: Therefore, the appearance

original: nyid stong pa yin la stong pa nyid snang ba'o //
analyzed: nyid stong pa yin la stong pa nyid snang ba'o //
translated: itself is the void, and the void itself is the appearance.

original: gnyis ka med pa ma yin pa ni gnyis ma grub pas na gnyis su med pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis ka med pa ma yin pa ni gnyis ma grub pas na gnyis su med pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: Non-existence of both is not, because the two are not established, and so non-duality itself is not.

original: thams cad du khyab pa ni chos thams cad de'i ngo bo las ma 'das te /
analyzed: thams cad du khyab pa ni chos thams cad de'i ngo bo las ma 'das te /
translated: Pervasion is that all things do not go beyond that nature.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gcig pa'i ngang bzhin te tha mi dad do //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gcig pa'i ngang bzhin te tha mi dad do //
translated: Samsara and nirvana are of one nature, not different.

original: dper na rgya mtsho chen po la rlabs du ma snang yang gzhi rgya mtsho chen po'i chu'i rang bzhin du ro gcig go //
analyzed: dper na rgya mtsho chen po la rlabs du ma snang yang gzhi rgya mtsho chen po'i chu'i rang bzhin du ro gcig go //
translated: For example, although many waves appear on the great ocean, they are of one taste in the water of the great ocean.

original: de bzhin du chos sna tshogs du mar snang yang don du na gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin las ma 'das so //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos sna tshogs du mar snang yang don du na gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin las ma 'das so //
translated: In the same way, although many different phenomena appear, in reality they do not go beyond the nature of nonduality.

original: de bas na dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin de nyid yin gyi de las gzhan pa ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: de bas na dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin de nyid yin gyi de las gzhan pa ni ma yin no ;
translated: Therefore, that is the nature of all things, and nothing else.

original: / mi 'gyur ba ni 'gro 'ong med pa ste /
analyzed: / mi 'gyur ba ni 'gro 'ong med pa ste /
translated: Unchanging means without coming or going.

original: rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa'i khyad par gyis 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang / rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa'i ye shes zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa'i khyad par gyis 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang / rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa'i ye shes zhes brjod kyi /
translated: Due to the difference of realization and nonrealization, samsara and nirvana and the wisdom of realization and nonrealization are expressed.

original: don yang dag par na tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don yang dag par na tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: In reality, they are not different.

original: dper na tha gu sprul du snang ba ni tha gur ma rtogs par sprul du snang gi rtogs na sbrul du snang ba'i rang bzhin nyid tha gu yin la tha gu nyid sprul lo //
analyzed: dper na tha gu sprul du snang ba ni tha gur ma rtogs par sprul du snang gi rtogs na sbrul du snang ba'i rang bzhin nyid tha gu yin la tha gu nyid sprul lo //
translated: For example, a rope appearing as a snake is a snake only when the rope is not recognized. When it is recognized, the very nature of the appearance as a snake is the rope, and the rope itself is the snake.

original: sbrul gsal bar bya ba'am tha gu gzhag par bya ba ci yang med do //
analyzed: sbrul gsal bar bya ba'am tha gu gzhag par bya ba ci yang med do //
translated: There is nothing at all to clarify as a snake or to posit as a rope.

original: de bzhin du phyag rgya chen po zung du 'jug pa'i rang bzhin ma rtogs na sna tshogs su snang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du phyag rgya chen po zung du 'jug pa'i rang bzhin ma rtogs na sna tshogs su snang ste /
translated: Likewise, when the nature of the union of the great seal is not recognized, it appears as a variety.

original: yang dag par rtogs na rtog pa sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin nyid mi rtogs pa'i rang bzhin zung du 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: yang dag par rtogs na rtog pa sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin nyid mi rtogs pa'i rang bzhin zung du 'jug pa yin la /
translated: When it is perfectly recognized, the very nature of the variety of thoughts is the nature of nonthought, the union.

original: mi rtogs pa nyid rtog pa sna tshogs su snang ste /🔽'dir rtog pa bsal bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: mi rtogs pa nyid rtog pa sna tshogs su snang ste / 'dir rtog pa bsal bar bya ba'am /
translated: Nonthought itself appears as the variety of thoughts.🔽Here, there is nothing at all to remove thoughts

original: mi rtogs pa gzhag par bya ba ci yang med do //
analyzed: mi rtogs pa gzhag par bya ba ci yang med do //
translated: or to posit as nonthought.

original: de yang 'di skad du /
analyzed: de yang 'di skad du /
translated: Moreover, it is said:

original: 'di rnams chos ni mya ngan 'das //🔽rmongs pa la ni 'khor ba'i tshul//
analyzed: 'di rnams chos ni mya ngan 'das // rmongs pa la ni 'khor ba'i tshul//
translated: These phenomena are nirvana.🔽For the confused, they are the mode of samsara.

original: rmongs med 'khro ba ngag pas ni //
analyzed: rmongs med 'khro ba ngag pas ni //
translated: For the unconfused, samsara is not.

original: 'khor ba mya ngan 'das par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'khor ba mya ngan 'das par 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Samsara becomes nirvana.

original: dus thams cad pa ni rtogs kyang rung ma rtogs kyang rung rang gi ngo bo gnyis su med pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'o //
analyzed: dus thams cad pa ni rtogs kyang rung ma rtogs kyang rung rang gi ngo bo gnyis su med pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'o //
translated: The all-time [nature] is that whether there is realization or not, it does not change into anything other than its own nature, which is nondual.

original: gzhan yang phyag rgya chen po la sku gsum du gzhag pa ni nyams su myong ba'i shes pa nyid la gzhag ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang phyag rgya chen po la sku gsum du gzhag pa ni nyams su myong ba'i shes pa nyid la gzhag ste /
translated: Moreover, the classification of the great seal into three bodies is as follows: It is classified in terms of the consciousness that experiences it.

original: de yang / 'dus ma byas pa chos kyi sku //
analyzed: de yang / 'dus ma byas pa chos kyi sku //
translated: The unconditioned is the dharmakaya.

original: rtogs pa longs spyod rdzogs mtshan nyid //
analyzed: rtogs pa longs spyod rdzogs mtshan nyid //
translated: Realization is the defining characteristic of the sambhogakaya.

original: sna tshogs 'byung ba sprul pa'i sku //
analyzed: sna tshogs 'byung ba sprul pa'i sku //
translated: The arising of diversity is the nirmanakaya.

original: gnyug ma ngo bo nyid kyi sku //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gnyug ma ngo bo nyid kyi sku // zhes gsungs so //
translated: The intrinsic nature is the svabhavikakaya.

original: des na rtog pa gang gis kyang ma bslad pa'i shes pa ni yod med ces bya ba dang / @180b gnyis dang gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba'i sgro skur gang med pa ste chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: des na rtog pa gang gis kyang ma bslad pa'i shes pa ni yod med ces bya ba dang / @180b gnyis dang gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba'i sgro skur gang med pa ste chos kyi sku'o //
translated: Thus, consciousness that is unadulterated by any thought is the dharmakaya, which is free from all the superimpositions and denigrations of existence and nonexistence, of being one and being many, and of being neither one nor many.

original: gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin rtogs nas bde ba chen po nyams su myong pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin rtogs nas bde ba chen po nyams su myong pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: The experience of great bliss through the realization of the nondual nature is the sambhogakāya.

original: rang gi ngo bo las ma g-yos kyang sna tshogs su snang ba ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo las ma g-yos kyang sna tshogs su snang ba ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: The appearance of diversity without wavering from one’s essence is the nirmāṇakāya.

original: de ltar tha snyad tsam du gsum du dbye ba yod na yang de kho na nyid kyi shes pa la dbye ba med de /
analyzed: de ltar tha snyad tsam du gsum du dbye ba yod na yang de kho na nyid kyi shes pa la dbye ba med de /
translated: Thus, although there is a division into three merely in terms of convention, there is no division in the knowledge of suchness.

original: ngo bo gcig pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku'o //
analyzed: ngo bo gcig pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku'o //
translated: The single essence is the svabhāvikakāya.

original: theg pa thun mong gi sku gsum rnam par gzhag pa ni ngo bo nyid la dbye ba med de /
analyzed: theg pa thun mong gi sku gsum rnam par gzhag pa ni ngo bo nyid la dbye ba med de /
translated: In the presentation of the three kāyas common to the vehicles, there is no division in the svabhāvikakāya.

original: chos tshul gyis brtsis na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi thugs yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul rnam par mi rtog pa cir yang mi 'dzin pa ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: chos tshul gyis brtsis na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi thugs yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul rnam par mi rtog pa cir yang mi 'dzin pa ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: Even when considered in terms of the way of the Dharma, the mind of a perfect buddha, the domain of experience of pure wisdom, nonconceptual and not grasping anything at all, is the dharmakāya.

original: sa chen po la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul du snang ba ni rten gzhal yas khang dang brten pa lha'i dkyil 'khor mtshan dang dpe byad dang / mi 'jigs pa la sog pas brgyan par snang ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //🔽lha dang mi'i mthong ba ma dag pa la ni phyin ci log tu snang /
analyzed: sa chen po la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul du snang ba ni rten gzhal yas khang dang brten pa lha'i dkyil 'khor mtshan dang dpe byad dang / mi 'jigs pa la sog pas brgyan par snang ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o // lha dang mi'i mthong ba ma dag pa la ni phyin ci log tu snang /
translated: The appearance as the domain of experience of a bodhisattva who is practicing on the great stages is the saṃbhogakāya, which appears as the immeasurable mansion that is the support and the maṇḍala of deities that are the supported, adorned with the major and minor marks and the four types of fearlessness.🔽The appearance as the domain of experience of a bodhisattva who is practicing on the stage of a buddha is the nirmāṇakāya, which appears as the various bodies of the tathāgatas, in whatever forms will tame whomever, to those to be tamed who have impure vision, appearing as mistaken,

original: mthong ba dag pa la ni gang dang gang gis 'dul ba la de dang de'i ngo bor sku sna tshogs su de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po'i byin rlabs dang / sngon gyi smon lam dang sems can gyi mos pa'i dbang gis snang ba ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: mthong ba dag pa la ni gang dang gang gis 'dul ba la de dang de'i ngo bor sku sna tshogs su de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po'i byin rlabs dang / sngon gyi smon lam dang sems can gyi mos pa'i dbang gis snang ba ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: and to those with pure vision, appearing as the blessing of the great compassion of the tathāgatas, due to the power of their previous aspirations and the aspirations of sentient beings.

original: 'di rnams tha snyad tsam du bshad kyang rang gi ngo bo la tha snyad kyi dbye ba med de /
analyzed: 'di rnams tha snyad tsam du bshad kyang rang gi ngo bo la tha snyad kyi dbye ba med de /
translated: Although these are explained as mere conventions, in their own essence, they are not divided into conventions.

original: ngo bo lhun gyis grub par gcig pas na ngo bo nyid sku'o //
analyzed: ngo bo lhun gyis grub par gcig pas na ngo bo nyid sku'o //
translated: Since they are one in the essence that is spontaneously present, they are the svabhāvikakāya.

original: de'i yang 'di skad du /
analyzed: de'i yang 'di skad du /
translated: Moreover, it is stated:

original: 'chad pa po nga chos kyang nga //
analyzed: 'chad pa po nga chos kyang nga //
translated: The expounder is I, and the Dharma is I.

original: rang gi tshogs ldan nyan pa nga //
analyzed: rang gi tshogs ldan nyan pa nga //
translated: The listener who possesses my assembly is I.

original: 'jig rten ston pa bsgrub bya nga //
analyzed: 'jig rten ston pa bsgrub bya nga //
translated: The world, the teacher, and the object of attainment are I.

original: 'jig rten 'jig rten 'das par //🔽zhes gsungs pas /🔽'ched pa po ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku /🔽chos ni chos kyi sku /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'jig rten 'das par // zhes gsungs pas / 'ched pa po ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku / chos ni chos kyi sku /
translated: The mundane and the supramundane are I.

original: rang gi tshogs ldan nyan pa ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: rang gi tshogs ldan nyan pa ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: Thus, the expounder is the Enjoyment Body, the Dharma is the Reality Body, and the listener who possesses my assembly is the Emanation Body.

original: des na thams cad kyi ngo bo yin pas na ngo bo nyid kyi sku'o //
analyzed: des na thams cad kyi ngo bo yin pas na ngo bo nyid kyi sku'o //
translated: Therefore, since it is the essence of all, it is the Essence Body.

original: de lta bu'i rim pa ni zung du 'jug pa ni 'od gsal ba dang / stong pa nyid su med pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rim pa ni zung du 'jug pa ni 'od gsal ba dang / stong pa nyid su med pa ste /
translated: Such a stage is the union of the clear light and emptiness.

original: ngo bo nyid la dbyer med kyang chos tshul gyis brtsis na 'od gsal ba dang stong pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la dbyer med kyang chos tshul gyis brtsis na 'od gsal ba dang stong pa'o //
translated: Although they are inseparable in the essence, they are counted as clear light and emptiness in terms of the mode of Dharma.

original: rigs pas yang dag par brtags na dngos po med pa ni stong pa yin la /
analyzed: rigs pas yang dag par brtags na dngos po med pa ni stong pa yin la /
translated: When properly examined by reasoning, the non-existence of things is emptiness,

original: mnyam par nyams su myong ba ni 'od gsal pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par nyams su myong ba ni 'od gsal pa'o //
translated: and the experience of equality is clear light.

original: 'od gsal @181a * //
analyzed: 'od gsal @181a * //
translated: Clear light

original: las kyang stong pa gzhan ma yin la stong pa las kyang 'od gsal ba gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: las kyang stong pa gzhan ma yin la stong pa las kyang 'od gsal ba gzhan ma yin te /
translated: Karma is not empty of something else, and luminosity is not empty of something else.

original: dper na smig rgyu las chur snang yang yang dag par na chu'i dngos po med do //
analyzed: dper na smig rgyu las chur snang yang yang dag par na chu'i dngos po med do //
translated: For example, although water appears from a mirage, in reality there is no entity of water.

original: de bzhin du 'od gsal ba nyid la rnam par dpyad na rang bzhin med pa stong pa yin yang gtan ma grub pa ri bong gi rva lta bu'i stong pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'od gsal ba nyid la rnam par dpyad na rang bzhin med pa stong pa yin yang gtan ma grub pa ri bong gi rva lta bu'i stong pa ni ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, when luminosity itself is analyzed, it is empty of intrinsic nature, but it is not empty like the utter nonestablishment of a rabbit’s horns.

original: rang bzhin med pa stong pa nyid 'od gsal ba nyams su myong pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa stong pa nyid 'od gsal ba nyams su myong pa ste /
translated: The experience of empty luminosity is the emptiness of the absence of intrinsic nature.

original: dngos po yod par rigs pas grub pa snang ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po yod par rigs pas grub pa snang ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the appearance that is established by reasoning as an existent thing.

original: de bas na 'od gsal ba nyid stong pa nyid 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'od gsal ba nyid stong pa nyid 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: Therefore, luminosity itself is emptiness, and emptiness is luminosity.

original: tha dad ma yin pas gnyis med zung du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad ma yin pas gnyis med zung du 'jug pa'o //
translated: Since they are not different, they are nondual and united.

original: zung du 'jug pa yang gzhan gyis gnyis su snang ba'i zhen pa bzlog pa'i phyir brung du 'jug pa dang gnyis su med pa zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: zung du 'jug pa yang gzhan gyis gnyis su snang ba'i zhen pa bzlog pa'i phyir brung du 'jug pa dang gnyis su med pa zhes brjod kyi /
translated: Moreover, union is called “nondual” and “united” in order to reverse the conception of duality in the appearance of others.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la zung du 'jug pa dang gnyis su med pa gnyis ma grub pas na zung du 'jug pa dang / gnyis su med pa nyid kyang mi gnas so //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la zung du 'jug pa dang gnyis su med pa gnyis ma grub pas na zung du 'jug pa dang / gnyis su med pa nyid kyang mi gnas so //
translated: Since the two, the union of its own characteristics and nonduality, are not established, the union and nonduality themselves do not abide.

original: des na 'di la ming dang ngos gzung ba'am /
analyzed: des na 'di la ming dang ngos gzung ba'am /
translated: Therefore, in this [nonduality], there is no designation by name or🔽identification.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni gzhag pa med do //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni gzhag pa med do //
translated: There is no establishment of this as 'that.'

original: lhun gyis grub pa ni dper na mtho yor la mir shes pa 'khrul nas snang ste /
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa ni dper na mtho yor la mir shes pa 'khrul nas snang ste /
translated: Spontaneously present means, for example, that when one mistakes a cairn for a person, it appears as a person.

original: ma rtogs na mir snang zhing /
analyzed: ma rtogs na mir snang zhing /
translated: If one does not understand, it appears as a person.

original: rtogs na de nyid mtho yor yin la /🔽des mi gsal ba bya ba'am /
analyzed: rtogs na de nyid mtho yor yin la / des mi gsal ba bya ba'am /
translated: If one does understand, it is just a cairn.🔽It does not clarify anything at all

original: mtho yor bsgrub par bya ba ci yang med do //
analyzed: mtho yor bsgrub par bya ba ci yang med do //
translated: or establish the cairn.🔽Likewise, if one does not understand the meaning, the nature of nondual

original: de bzhin du don rang gi ngo bo gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin ma rtogs na gnyis su snang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du don rang gi ngo bo gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin ma rtogs na gnyis su snang ste /
translated: essence, it appears as dual.

original: rtogs tsam na de nyid gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: rtogs tsam na de nyid gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: As soon as one understands, it is the wisdom of nonduality.

original: 'dir yang rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa'i khyad par gyis gnyis su snang ba'i rtog pa dang / gnyis su med pa'i mi rtog pa zhes dgag sgrub byed kyang de kho na nyid kyi shes pa la ma rtogs pa'i dus na yang don rang gi ngo bo dang gnyis su med de zung du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa'i khyad par gyis gnyis su snang ba'i rtog pa dang / gnyis su med pa'i mi rtog pa zhes dgag sgrub byed kyang de kho na nyid kyi shes pa la ma rtogs pa'i dus na yang don rang gi ngo bo dang gnyis su med de zung du 'jug pa'o //
translated: Here, too, there is a distinction between realization and nonrealization, and so there is a conceptualization of duality and a nonconceptualization of nonduality, which are negated and affirmed. But even at the time of nonrealization, the cognition of thatness is not dual from the object, its own nature, and so they are united.

original: bla ma dam pa'i zhal nas rtogs pa'i dus na yang zung du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma dam pa'i zhal nas rtogs pa'i dus na yang zung du 'jug pa'o //
translated: From the mouth of the sublime guru, it is said that even at the time of realization, they are united.

original: 'bras bu phyag rgya chen po thob pa'i dus na yang de nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras bu phyag rgya chen po thob pa'i dus na yang de nyid do //
translated: At the time of attaining the result, mahāmudrā, it is also that.

original: des na dus thams cad du mi 'gyur ba ni ma bcos pa'o //
analyzed: des na dus thams cad du mi 'gyur ba ni ma bcos pa'o //
translated: Therefore, being unchanging at all times is unfabricated.

original: de lta bu dang ldan pa'i phyag rgya chen po ste /
analyzed: de lta bu dang ldan pa'i phyag rgya chen po ste /
translated: Mahāmudrā endowed with suchness is

original: de ltar rtogs pa ni lta ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa ni lta ba'o //
translated: realization.

original: sgom pa ni dus de nyid las sems ma yengs par 'jog pa yin te /
analyzed: sgom pa ni dus de nyid las sems ma yengs par 'jog pa yin te /
translated: Meditation is resting the mind without distraction at that time.🔽Also:

original: de yang / sgom pa po med sgom pa'ang mad //
analyzed: de yang / sgom pa po med sgom pa'ang mad //
translated: There is no meditator and also no meditation.

original: lha med sngags kyang yod ma yin //
analyzed: lha med sngags kyang yod ma yin //
translated: There is no deity and also no mantra.

original: spros pa med pa'i rang bzhin las //
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i rang bzhin las //
translated: From the nature free of conceptual elaborations,

original: lha dang sngags kyang yang dag gnas //
analyzed: lha dang sngags kyang yang dag gnas //
translated: The deity and mantra are also the true state.

original: @181b zhes gsungs pas na phyag rgya chen po nyid mi rtog pa ni bcos ma'i sgom pa ched du gtad pa gang yang mi 'dod de /
analyzed: @181b zhes gsungs pas na phyag rgya chen po nyid mi rtog pa ni bcos ma'i sgom pa ched du gtad pa gang yang mi 'dod de /
translated: Thus, the Great Seal itself is nonconceptual. It does not accept any contrived meditation that is deliberately focused.

original: de nyid kun gyi ngo bo yin pas na /
analyzed: de nyid kun gyi ngo bo yin pas na /
translated: Since it is the essence of everything,

original: bar ma chod par spyod lam bzhir ma yengs par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bar ma chod par spyod lam bzhir ma yengs par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: one should meditate without distraction in the four daily activities without interruption.

original: de yang 'di skad du /🔽chu bo klung 'bab gzhung dang ni //
analyzed: de yang 'di skad du / chu bo klung 'bab gzhung dang ni //
translated: Moreover, it is said:🔽Like the flow of a river

original: mar me 'bar ba'i rtse mo ltar //
analyzed: mar me 'bar ba'i rtse mo ltar //
translated: and the tip of a flame,

original: sngags kyi de nyid rjes 'brangs nas //
analyzed: sngags kyi de nyid rjes 'brangs nas //
translated: following the reality of mantra,

original: rgyun mi 'chad pa'i bsam gtan thob //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad pa'i bsam gtan thob //
translated: attain uninterrupted meditative concentration.

original: ces gsungs pas mnyam par gzhag pa dang rjes thob med par chos thams cad de nyid kyi ngo bor shes par bya /
analyzed: ces gsungs pas mnyam par gzhag pa dang rjes thob med par chos thams cad de nyid kyi ngo bor shes par bya /
translated: Thus, without meditative equipoise and post-equipoise, one should understand all phenomena to be the essence of reality.

original: goms par bya'o //🔽gzhan yang / gang yang sgom pa po nyid med //
analyzed: goms par bya'o // gzhan yang / gang yang sgom pa po nyid med //
translated: One should become familiar with that.🔽Moreover:🔽There is no meditator at all,

original: gang yang rnam par sgom pa med //
analyzed: gang yang rnam par sgom pa med //
translated: and there is no meditation.

original: bsgom bya nyid kyang yod ma yin //
analyzed: bsgom bya nyid kyang yod ma yin //
translated: There is no object of meditation.

original: de yi de nyid bsgom par bya //
analyzed: de yi de nyid bsgom par bya //
translated: One should meditate on its reality.

original: zhes gsungs pas sgom pa po dang / bsgom par bya ba dang sgom pa'i ched du bya ba med de /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas sgom pa po dang / bsgom par bya ba dang sgom pa'i ched du bya ba med de /
translated: Thus, there is no meditator, no meditation, and no purpose for meditation.

original: de nyid la ma yengs par gzhag go //
analyzed: de nyid la ma yengs par gzhag go //
translated: Rest without distraction in that.

original: de nyid la ma yengs par bsgoms pa yang rtog pa thams cad glo bur du rkyen gzhan la brten nas bskyed de /
analyzed: de nyid la ma yengs par bsgoms pa yang rtog pa thams cad glo bur du rkyen gzhan la brten nas bskyed de /
translated: Also, meditation without distraction in that is as follows: All thoughts are suddenly generated in dependence on other conditions.

original: rang bzhin ngo bos ni ma skyes la //
analyzed: rang bzhin ngo bos ni ma skyes la //
translated: They are not essentially generated by nature.

original: gong du rtog pa'i rkyen ma tshogs pa na /
analyzed: gong du rtog pa'i rkyen ma tshogs pa na /
translated: Previously, when the conditions for thoughts did not assemble,

original: shes pa rkyen gyis ma bslad pa ma bcos pa'i gnyug ma sgro skur dang bral ba ni phyag rgya chen po ste /
analyzed: shes pa rkyen gyis ma bslad pa ma bcos pa'i gnyug ma sgro skur dang bral ba ni phyag rgya chen po ste /
translated: the uncontrived, innate, and unadulterated consciousness that is not affected by conditions is mahāmudrā.

original: de las phyis shes pa skye ba rkyen gyis bslad pa ni brtags na ngos gzung du med pas na /
analyzed: de las phyis shes pa skye ba rkyen gyis bslad pa ni brtags na ngos gzung du med pas na /
translated: Later, when the adulterated consciousness that is generated by conditions is examined, it is not identified.

original: bzhi pa de yang de bzhin no zhes bya bas gong bzhin du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa de yang de bzhin no zhes bya bas gong bzhin du shes par bya ste /
translated: The fourth is “that is also like that.”

original: bzhi pa ni phyis kyi rtogs pa'i rkyen gyis bslad pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni phyis kyi rtogs pa'i rkyen gyis bslad pa'o //
translated: The fourth is adulterated by the conditions of later thoughts.

original: de zhes bya ba ni shes pa gnyug ma ma bcos pa rkyen gyis ma bslad pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni shes pa gnyug ma ma bcos pa rkyen gyis ma bslad pa'o //
translated: “That” is the innate, uncontrived, and unadulterated consciousness.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni phyis kyi shes pa rtog pa dang bcas pa ni gong mar bsdu'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni phyis kyi shes pa rtog pa dang bcas pa ni gong mar bsdu'o //
translated: The word “also” indicates that the subsequent conceptual cognition is included in the former.

original: de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni snang ba'am rtog pa skyes ma thag tu gong ma'i rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni snang ba'am rtog pa skyes ma thag tu gong ma'i rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: “Just so” means that as soon as the appearance or the conceptual cognition arises, it should be recognized as having the nature of the former.

original: de bas na dbang po rnams yul la mi dgag ste /
analyzed: de bas na dbang po rnams yul la mi dgag ste /
translated: Therefore, the sense faculties are not blocked with regard to their objects.

original: ci dang ci snang ba thams cad de'i rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ci dang ci snang ba thams cad de'i rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: Whatever appears, all of it should be recognized as having that nature.

original: de la rtog pa ci skyes pa la rigs pas brtags shing rang bzhin med par byed pa ni dman par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la rtog pa ci skyes pa la rigs pas brtags shing rang bzhin med par byed pa ni dman par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one examines with reasoning whatever conceptual cognition arises and makes it devoid of intrinsic nature, that is inferior.

original: dper na skyur du ra'i ro nyams su myong nas mthong ma thag tu skyur mor shes te /
analyzed: dper na skyur du ra'i ro nyams su myong nas mthong ma thag tu skyur mor shes te /
translated: For example, having experienced the taste of a lemon, as soon as one sees another lemon, one recognizes it as sour.

original: skyur mo nyid kyang skyu rung yin la skyu ru ra nyid kyang skyur mor shes so //
analyzed: skyur mo nyid kyang skyu rung yin la skyu ru ra nyid kyang skyur mor shes so //
translated: The sourness is the lemon, and the lemon is recognized as sour.

original: de bzhin du gong du lung dang / rigs pa dang / bla ma'i man ngag gis nyams su blangs nas rtogs pas phyis dngos po snang ba nyid stong par shes la /
analyzed: de bzhin du gong du lung dang / rigs pa dang / bla ma'i man ngag gis nyams su blangs nas rtogs pas phyis dngos po snang ba nyid stong par shes la /
translated: Likewise, having previously realized [emptiness] through the scriptures, reasoning, and the guru’s instructions, later on, one will know that the appearances of things are empty.

original: stong pa nyid snang bar shes so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid snang bar shes so //
translated: Likewise, having previously realized [emptiness] through scripture, reasoning, and the guru’s instructions, later on, one will know that the appearing entities are empty and that emptiness appears.

original: @182a * // de bas na dbyer med par bya'o //
analyzed: @182a * // de bas na dbyer med par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, [emptiness and appearance] should be made inseparable.

original: de yang 'di skad du /
analyzed: de yang 'di skad du /
translated: Moreover, it is said:

original: gang phyir yid kyis mi sgom par //
analyzed: gang phyir yid kyis mi sgom par //
translated: Since [emptiness] is not meditated upon by the mind,

original: 'gro ba thams cad bsgom par bya //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad bsgom par bya //
translated: the entire world is meditated upon.

original: thams cad chos ni yongs shes na //
analyzed: thams cad chos ni yongs shes na //
translated: When all phenomena are fully understood,

original: sgom pa nyid ni sgom pa min //
analyzed: sgom pa nyid ni sgom pa min //
translated: meditation itself is not meditation.

original: zhes gsungs pas de nyid la ma yengs par 'jog pa ni sgom pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas de nyid la ma yengs par 'jog pa ni sgom pa'o //
translated: Thus, to rest undistractedly in that [emptiness] is meditation.

original: de yang do ha las /
analyzed: de yang do ha las /
translated: Moreover, the Dohās say:

original: mda' bsnun gyis smras pa /
analyzed: mda' bsnun gyis smras pa /
translated: The one with the arrow said:

original: kye lags gang zhig brdzun pa de bor la //
analyzed: kye lags gang zhig brdzun pa de bor la //
translated: “Oh! Abandon that which is false,

original: gang la zhen pa yod na de yang thong //
analyzed: gang la zhen pa yod na de yang thong //
translated: and if there is attachment, let that go too.

original: rtogs par gyur na thams cad de yin te //
analyzed: rtogs par gyur na thams cad de yin te //
translated: When there is realization, everything is that,

original: de las gzhan pa sus kyang shes mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa sus kyang shes mi 'gyur //
translated: and no one else will understand it.

original: zhe'o // des na sna tshogs su snang ba thams cad sems nyid yin la ;
analyzed: zhe'o // des na sna tshogs su snang ba thams cad sems nyid yin la ;
translated: Thus, all appearances of variety are the mind itself.

original: sems nyid zhen pa thams cad med par rtogs pa na ci byung pa thams cad de ltar shes par byas la bsgom mo //
analyzed: sems nyid zhen pa thams cad med par rtogs pa na ci byung pa thams cad de ltar shes par byas la bsgom mo //
translated: When the mind itself is realized to be free from all clinging, whatever occurs should be understood in that way and meditated upon.

original: sgom pa la yang dpe gsum ste /
analyzed: sgom pa la yang dpe gsum ste /
translated: There are three examples for meditation.

original: chu dngas pa dang / nor bu chu 'dong bcug pa dang / ma rnyogs par gzhag pas dngas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chu dngas pa dang / nor bu chu 'dong bcug pa dang / ma rnyogs par gzhag pas dngas par 'gyur te /
translated: Just as clear water, a jewel, or a mirror are made clear by being placed in water, a jewel, or a mirror,

original: de bzhin du rtog pa thams cad 'gegs pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rtog pa spang pa'i phyir gnyen po ye shes bsgom pa ni bcos ma'i sgom pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rtog pa thams cad 'gegs pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rtog pa spang pa'i phyir gnyen po ye shes bsgom pa ni bcos ma'i sgom pa'o //
translated: in the same way, meditation on the antidote, wisdom, is a contrived meditation in order to block all thoughts and abandon thoughts that are discordant factors.

original: chu ma rnyogs par bzhag na rang dngas pa bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin shes par byas nas ma bcos par 'jog pa ni phyag rgya chen po'i sgom pa'o //
analyzed: chu ma rnyogs par bzhag na rang dngas pa bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin shes par byas nas ma bcos par 'jog pa ni phyag rgya chen po'i sgom pa'o //
translated: Like water that is not disturbed but remains clear, having understood the nature of all things, to rest without contrivance is the meditation of mahāmudrā.

original: de lta bu'i shes pas ci dang ci byed pa thams cad de'i rang bzhin du byed pa ni spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i shes pas ci dang ci byed pa thams cad de'i rang bzhin du byed pa ni spyod pa ste /
translated: Whatever is done with such an understanding is done with the nature of that.

original: de yang spyod pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang spyod pa ni gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, conduct is threefold:

original: spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa dang / spros pa med pa'i spyod pa dang / shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa dang / spros pa med pa'i spyod pa dang / shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: conduct with elaboration, conduct without elaboration, and extremely unelaborate conduct.

original: de la spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de la spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Among those, conduct with elaboration is conduct with signs.

original: spros pa med pa'i spyod pa ni gsang ba la stsogs pa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i spyod pa ni gsang ba la stsogs pa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: Conduct without elaboration is secret conduct and so on.

original: shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa ni phyag rgya chen po las gzhan du ma bstan te /
analyzed: shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa ni phyag rgya chen po las gzhan du ma bstan te /
translated: Extremely unelaborate conduct is not explained as being other than mahāmudrā.

original: des zin pa'i spyod pa ci byas pa thams cad ni spyod pa'o //
analyzed: des zin pa'i spyod pa ci byas pa thams cad ni spyod pa'o //
translated: Whatever is done within the scope of that is conduct.

original: de lta bu la goms par gyur pas lhun gyis grub ste /
analyzed: de lta bu la goms par gyur pas lhun gyis grub ste /
translated: Since one becomes familiar with that, it is effortless.

original: mngon du gyur pa ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: mngon du gyur pa ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: Manifestation is the result.

original: de lta bu'i phyag rgya chen po ni dri ma dang bral ba'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i phyag rgya chen po ni dri ma dang bral ba'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: Mahāmudrā like that is the result free from stains.

original: dri ma ni dgag pa dang sgrub pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa rnams med pa ni dri ma dang bral ba'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: dri ma ni dgag pa dang sgrub pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa rnams med pa ni dri ma dang bral ba'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: The absence of concepts of negation, affirmation, and so on is the result free from stains.

original: mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
translated: It is the connate joy free from characteristics.

original: 'bras bu phyag rgya chen po ma bcos par lhun gyis grub pha ngo bo nyid kyi rim pa @182b mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu phyag rgya chen po ma bcos par lhun gyis grub pha ngo bo nyid kyi rim pa @182b mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: The result is the great seal, the uncontrived, spontaneously present natural state.

original: de lta bu'i phyag rgya chen po las sems can gyi don du 'bras bu gzugs kyi sku gnyis 'byung ba ni dam tshig gi phyag rgyar bshad de /
analyzed: de lta bu'i phyag rgya chen po las sems can gyi don du 'bras bu gzugs kyi sku gnyis 'byung ba ni dam tshig gi phyag rgyar bshad de /
translated: The two form bodies that are the result for the sake of sentient beings arise from such a great seal.

original: de la dam tshig ni sa ma ya 'bum snge ste /
analyzed: de la dam tshig ni sa ma ya 'bum snge ste /
translated: Samaya is the Sanskrit word for pledge.

original: sa las drangs nas sa sa ke te zhes bya ba ste brda yin la /
analyzed: sa las drangs nas sa sa ke te zhes bya ba ste brda yin la /
translated: It is derived from samayam, which means “to come together.”

original: phyag rgya ni mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya ni mtshon pa ste /
translated: A seal is a symbol.

original: he ru ka'i brda'i sgo nas thabs snang ba mtshon cing btsun mo'i brda'i sgo nas shes rab stong pa nyid mtshon par byed la /
analyzed: he ru ka'i brda'i sgo nas thabs snang ba mtshon cing btsun mo'i brda'i sgo nas shes rab stong pa nyid mtshon par byed la /
translated: The method, appearance, is symbolized by the symbol of Heruka, and emptiness, wisdom, is symbolized by the symbol of the queen.

original: gnyis pa 'khyud pa'i brda'i sgo nas gnyis su med pa'i ye shes zung du 'jug pa mtshon pa ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa 'khyud pa'i brda'i sgo nas gnyis su med pa'i ye shes zung du 'jug pa mtshon pa ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The symbol of the couple is the symbol of the nondual gnosis of union, which is the pledge seal.

original: dam tshig gi phyag rgya la yang las kyi phyag rgya bzhin du dga' ba bzhir dbye ste /
analyzed: dam tshig gi phyag rgya la yang las kyi phyag rgya bzhin du dga' ba bzhir dbye ste /
translated: Also, with respect to the pledge seal, the four joys are divided as with the action seal.

original: de la dang po rgyu bsod nams kyi tshogs nas brtsams te rgyu'i he ru ka mngon par byang chub pa ldas bskyed pa ni sna tshogs kyi rtog pa yod pas rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i skad cig ma la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de la dang po rgyu bsod nams kyi tshogs nas brtsams te rgyu'i he ru ka mngon par byang chub pa ldas bskyed pa ni sna tshogs kyi rtog pa yod pas rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i skad cig ma la dga' ba'o //
translated: With respect to that, the first joy is the moment of various aspects, since it has various conceptions, beginning with the cause, the accumulation of merit, and generating the causal Heruka through the ten aspects of manifest enlightenment.🔽Supreme joy is the moment of complete maturation,

original: lha ma'i 'khor lo dbyung pa'i phyir mkha' gsang byin gyis brlabs nas snyoms par zhugs nas rdo rje nor bu'i grong gi dkyil du byang chub kyi sems khu ba'i rnam pa las bde ba'i ngo bo nyams su myong ba ni rnam par smin pa'i skad cig ma la
analyzed: lha ma'i 'khor lo dbyung pa'i phyir mkha' gsang byin gyis brlabs nas snyoms par zhugs nas rdo rje nor bu'i grong gi dkyil du byang chub kyi sems khu ba'i rnam pa las bde ba'i ngo bo nyams su myong ba ni rnam par smin pa'i skad cig ma la
translated: the experience of the nature of bliss from the form of the bodhicitta in the center of the city of the vajra jewel, having entered into union after the consecration of the space and the secret for the purpose of generating the wheel of the deity and the goddess.

original: mchog tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba'o //
translated: The moment of the absence of aspects is the joy of separation,🔽the experience of the nature of bliss from the form of the bodhicitta in the center of the city of the lotus of the sexual organ of the consort, having entered into union for the purpose of generating the wheel of the deity and the goddess.

original: de nas sku gsung thugs kyi yi ge gsum 'dod chags chen po'i rang bzhin ho dmar po gnyis kyi bar du chud pa'i dri za'i srog chags zhal du chud pas rje btsun dang rje btsun ma gnyis 'od du zhu ste /
analyzed: de nas sku gsung thugs kyi yi ge gsum 'dod chags chen po'i rang bzhin ho dmar po gnyis kyi bar du chud pa'i dri za'i srog chags zhal du chud pas rje btsun dang rje btsun ma gnyis 'od du zhu ste /
translated: Then, the three syllables of body, speech, and mind are placed between two red hoh syllables, the nature of great passion. The gandharva creature enters the mouth, and the two, the venerable and the venerable lady, melt into light.

original: zla ba dang nyi ma'i dbus na gnas pa'i thig le gnyis ni 'od gsal ba dang stong ba'o //
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma'i dbus na gnas pa'i thig le gnyis ni 'od gsal ba dang stong ba'o //
translated: The two drops that remain in the middle of the moon and sun are clear light and emptiness.

original: de zla ba la reg pa'i thig le ni shes rab ste stong pa'o //
analyzed: de zla ba la reg pa'i thig le ni shes rab ste stong pa'o //
translated: The drop that touches the moon is wisdom, which is emptiness.

original: steng nyi ma la reg pa ni 'od gsal ba ste thabs so ;
analyzed: steng nyi ma la reg pa ni 'od gsal ba ste thabs so ;
translated: The one that touches the sun above is clear light, which is method.

original: / gnyis dbyer med pa ni phan tshun gcig la gcig rgyas btab pa ste zung du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: / gnyis dbyer med pa ni phan tshun gcig la gcig rgyas btab pa ste zung du 'jug pa'o //
translated: The inseparability of the two is the mutual sealing of one into the other, which is union.

original: de ni mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i skad cig ma la lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de ni mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i skad cig ma la lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
translated: That is the innate joy in the instant that is free from characteristics.

original: de nas smon lam gyi dbang gyis puakka s'i la sogs pa'i chod med pa'i lha mo bzhi'i rdo rje glus bzhengs su gsol nas 'bras bu'i he ru ka gzugs kyi skur bzhengs pa ni rnam par nyed pa'i skad cig ma la dga' bral gyi dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de nas smon lam gyi dbang gyis puakka s'i la sogs pa'i chod med pa'i lha mo bzhi'i rdo rje glus bzhengs su gsol nas 'bras bu'i he ru ka gzugs kyi skur bzhengs pa ni rnam par nyed pa'i skad cig ma la dga' bral gyi dga' ba'o //
translated: Then, by the power of aspiration, he is roused by the vajra songs of the four goddesses, such as Puṇyā, and so on, and he arises in the form of the resultant heruka, which is the joy of separation from joy in the instant of dissolution.🔽Here also,

original: 'dir yang / bzhi pa de yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang / bzhi pa de yang de bzhin no //
translated: the fourth is just like that.

original: zhes bya bas snga ma bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas snga ma bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand as before.

original: dgongs pa snga ma bzhin du dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i dga' ba bzhi yang @183a * //🔽gcig tu byas nas /🔽skyes bu'i byed pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dgongs pa snga ma bzhin du dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i dga' ba bzhi yang @183a * // gcig tu byas nas / skyes bu'i byed pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ste /
translated: The four joys of the pledge seal are also made one, as before.🔽The result of the person’s action

original: sems can gyi don byed pas na gzugs kyi sku ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: sems can gyi don byed pas na gzugs kyi sku ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: is called the “result of the person’s action” because it performs the purpose of sentient beings.

original: rnam par nyed pa'i skad cig ma la dga' bral gyi dga' bar gzhag go //
analyzed: rnam par nyed pa'i skad cig ma la dga' bral gyi dga' bar gzhag go //
translated: The form body is the result of the person’s action, which is posited as the joy of separation from joy in the instant of dissolution.

original: de ltar na dga' ba bcu drug go //
analyzed: de ltar na dga' ba bcu drug go //
translated: Thus, there are sixteen joys.

original: 'dir yang phyag rgya chen po dang / dam tshig gi phyag rgya gnyis /
analyzed: 'dir yang phyag rgya chen po dang / dam tshig gi phyag rgya gnyis /
translated: Here, too, there are two kinds of seals: the great seal and the pledge seal.

original: bzhi pa de yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa de yang de bzhin no //
translated: The fourth is just like that.

original: zhes bya bas gong ma bzhin du gnyis su med par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas gong ma bzhin du gnyis su med par shes par bya'o //
translated: As above, one should understand it to be nondual.

original: dam tshig gi phyag rgya mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig gi phyag rgya mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: The concise teaching of the pledge seal.

original: gang zhig brgyud pa'i rim pa 'di //🔽bla ma'i zhabs la yun rings su //
analyzed: gang zhig brgyud pa'i rim pa 'di // bla ma'i zhabs la yun rings su //
translated: This lineage process🔽arises from long service

original: bsnyen bkur las byung goms pa yis //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur las byung goms pa yis //
translated: to the guru's feet.

original: bdag nyid dran phyir bris pa yin //🔽gzhan yang sems can bdag 'dra dang // don du gnyer ba gzhan dag dang // dad ldan byang chub don gnyer ba'i //
analyzed: bdag nyid dran phyir bris pa yin // gzhan yang sems can bdag 'dra dang // don du gnyer ba gzhan dag dang // dad ldan byang chub don gnyer ba'i //
translated: I wrote it for my own memory.🔽Moreover, I wrote a little🔽for the sake of other sentient beings like me🔽and for others who seek

original: don du bdag gis cung zhig bris //🔽gang yang bdag blo gti mug pas //🔽legs bshad gang yin nyes gyur pa //
analyzed: don du bdag gis cung zhig bris // gang yang bdag blo gti mug pas // legs bshad gang yin nyes gyur pa //
translated: and for the faithful who seek enlightenment.🔽Whatever is well explained🔽or whatever is faulty

original: ma rtogs dbang gis nor na yang //
analyzed: ma rtogs dbang gis nor na yang //
translated: is due to my own ignorance.

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis bzod par mdzod //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis bzod par mdzod //
translated: The wise should forgive me.

original: bla ma brgyud pa'i rim pa 'di //
analyzed: bla ma brgyud pa'i rim pa 'di //
translated: This lineage process

original: 'bad pas bdag gis bris pa las //
analyzed: 'bad pas bdag gis bris pa las //
translated: I wrote with effort.

original: des ni dge ba ci thob pas //
analyzed: des ni dge ba ci thob pas //
translated: By whatever virtue I have gained🔽May all sentient beings attain the Great Seal.

original: sems can phyag rgya chen por shog / bla ma brgyud pa'i rim pa'i man ngag ces bya ba phyag rgya chen po rnal du mchon par byed pa /
analyzed: sems can phyag rgya chen por shog / bla ma brgyud pa'i rim pa'i man ngag ces bya ba phyag rgya chen po rnal du mchon par byed pa /
translated: The Instruction of the Stages of the Gurus, called “The Great Seal That Brings Rest to the Natural State,”🔽is complete.

original: slob dpon chen po badzra p'a ni'i zhal snga nas kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: slob dpon chen po badzra p'a ni'i zhal snga nas kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: It was composed by the great master Vajrapāṇi.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po dhi roshkri dzny'a na'i zhabs dang / bod kyi lo ts'a ba 'brog mi jo sras kyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o /
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po dhi roshkri dzny'a na'i zhabs dang / bod kyi lo ts'a ba 'brog mi jo sras kyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o /
